results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/emails - Add account email

covered_items: POST/Valid Payload: Multiple happy-path scenarios validate 201 Created, association to account, and Location header (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC05).
POST/Invalid Payload: Malformed JSON, empty body, missing required fields, invalid email format (TC10, TC17, TC11, TC12).
POST/Validation: Path param UUID format and missing/empty accountId (TC07, TC08); optional/required headers behavior exercised (TC02, TC05, TC13).
POST/Large Payloads: Boundary test for max field sizes (TC16).
Error Scenarios per story: 400 for invalid accountId/malformed body and 404 for non-existent account (TC07, TC08, TC10, TC11, TC12, TC17, TC09).
Location header presence and basic correctness checked (TC01–TC05).
Security/Validation hardening: SQLi/XSS inputs handled (TC23, TC24).
Authorization: Unauthorized/forbidden covered (TC14).
Resiliency/Server error handling: External dependency down and slow DB leading to 503 handled (TC15, TC19).
Idempotent retry behavior under transient network failure is exercised at a high level (TC25).
Integration/Consistency: Verification via subsequent GET and downstream propagation (TC26).
gaps: Duplicate Submission: No explicit test for posting the same email twice to the same account (idempotency vs 409/400/200 behavior).
500 Internal Server Error: No scenario asserting behavior on unexpected server exceptions distinct from 503 dependency issues.
Response schema contract: Story specifies response as a JSON array of AccountEmail objects; several scenarios assert a single object rather than validating an array shape and contents consistently.
Content negotiation/headers: No assertions for Content-Type: application/json in request/response, nor Accept handling; no check that Produces is application/json.
Location header format: Presence is checked, but not the exact format/URL pattern of the created resource (or list) per story note.
Extra fields/query params: TC06/TC18 allow ambiguous outcomes (“201 or 400”); missing deterministic expectation and validation of error payload structure.
Header requirements: Missing X-Killbill-CreatedBy outcome is vague (400 vs 401). Need precise expectation aligned with API contract.
UUID pattern coverage: Only a blatantly invalid example is tested; no tests for edge-case UUID formats (uppercase, hyphenless if rejected, wrong segment lengths).
Rate limiting/throttling under bursts for POST is not covered (if applicable).
Concurrent requests: TC20 covers general success but lacks explicit checks for race conditions/duplication prevention and consistent ordering.
recommendations: Add explicit duplicate-submission tests: same email, same account posted twice; define expected status (e.g., 409 Conflict or idempotent 200/201 without duplication) and verify database state.
Introduce a test that simulates an unhandled server exception to assert 500 response shape and headers, distinct from 503 dependency failures.
Harden response contract checks: in all success scenarios assert response body is a JSON array of AccountEmail objects that includes the newly added entry; validate via JSON schema.
Assert headers for content negotiation: request Content-Type: application/json; response Content-Type: application/json; optionally Accept handling. Verify Produces application/json in all responses.
Validate Location header format with a regex or exact path to the created resource (or documented list URL) and ensure it is absolute/relative as per API spec.
Make TC06 and TC18 deterministic: decide whether unknown fields/query params are ignored (201) or rejected (400/422), and assert error body structure accordingly.
Clarify and assert the precise status for missing X-Killbill-CreatedBy (likely 400 Bad Request). Add a scenario for blank/whitespace values as well.
Extend UUID tests with edge cases: uppercase UUIDs, UUIDs without hyphens (if not allowed), incorrect segment lengths, and trailing/leading spaces.
If applicable, add a rate-limiting test for POST to verify correct status (e.g., 429) and headers (Retry-After).

Enhance TC20 to verify no duplicates under concurrency, atomicity, and consistent final state; include assertions for idempotency behavior during retries (e.g., with request/retry identifiers if supported).

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId} - Update account

covered_items: PUT - Valid Request: Happy paths covered (minimal and full updates) returning 204 and persisting changes.
PUT - Partial Update: Explicitly supported and tested (single-field update, subset of fields, null handling with treatNullAsReset true/false).
PUT - Non-Existing Resource: Negative case included for updating a non-existent account.
PUT - Concurrency Issues: Scenario for concurrent updates ensuring consistent final state.
Parameter validation: Invalid UUID format for accountId, empty body, invalid/malformed data types and values are covered with 400.
Headers: Required X-Killbill-CreatedBy present and missing-header negative case covered; optional Reason/Comment covered.
Query parameters: treatNullAsReset true/false behavior covered; extra/unknown query parameters scenario included.
Authorization: Unauthorized (missing/invalid token) returns 401.
Robustness: System error (500), large payload handling, latency/timeout behavior.
Security: Injection attempts in fields are detected/sanitized and not persisted.
Integration/Regression: Downstream propagation and regression for non-overwrite behavior validated.
Unsupported fields: Extra fields in payload are ignored without failing the update.
gaps: Status code semantics for non-existent account: Test expects 400; many APIs use 404. The story is silent—clarify and align.
Content negotiation: No tests for missing/incorrect Content-Type (e.g., 415) or Accept headers.
Response headers/body contract: Story says produces application/json, but 204 should have no body; no test asserts empty body and expected headers.
Idempotency: No scenario verifying that repeated identical PUTs do not change the outcome beyond the first update.
Audit metadata behavior: No validation that Reason/Comment (if provided) are recorded/audited as expected.
Query parameter validation: No test for invalid treatNullAsReset values (e.g., non-boolean) returning 400.
Path/Method rigor: No scenario for missing accountId in path or wrong method/route (405/404).
Authorization breadth: 403 Forbidden (authenticated but not authorized) not covered.
Field-level validation depth: Constraints for specific Account schema fields (e.g., email format, enums) are only broadly tested; not field-specific with clear error messages.
recommendations: Clarify and add a scenario for non-existent account status code (404 vs 400) and update tests accordingly.
Add content negotiation tests: missing Content-Type, wrong media type (expect 415), and optional Accept header handling.
Assert that 204 responses contain no body and include any required headers (e.g., Content-Type absent/consistent).
Add an idempotency test: send the same PUT twice and verify no additional changes/audit entries beyond the first.
Extend tests to verify audit trail behavior for X-Killbill-Reason and X-Killbill-Comment (e.g., entries in audit logs).
Add a test for invalid treatNullAsReset (e.g., treatNullAsReset=foo) to expect 400 with a descriptive error.
Add negative routing tests: request without accountId or wrong path/method to assert 404/405.
Include a 403 Forbidden scenario for an authenticated user lacking permission to update accounts.
Create field-specific validation scenarios (e.g., invalid email format, out-of-range numeric fields, invalid enum) with precise error assertions.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: DELETE /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/customFields - Remove custom fields from account

covered_items: DELETE - Valid Deletion: 204 with empty body when removing all or specific custom fields (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC13, TC14, TC18).
DELETE - Non-Existent Resource: Idempotent behavior returning 204 when account does not exist (TC06).
DELETE - Concurrency: High-concurrency successful deletions with consistent 204s (TC16) and idempotent re-deletion (TC15).
Required/Optional Headers: Required X-Killbill-CreatedBy enforced (TC01, TC02) and negative for missing header (TC07); optional Reason/Comment supported (TC03).

Path/Query Validation: Invalid accountId => 400 (TC05, TC19); invalid customField UUID => 400 (TC08, TC20); multi-valued query format exercised (A&B) (TC02); duplicates tolerated (TC14); extra query params ignored (TC09).
Success Contract: Response body empty on 204 and follow-up GET reflects deletion (TC01, TC02, TC04).
Error Handling: Unauthorized/forbidden access (TC10), backend failure 500 (TC11), network timeout/504 (TC12).
Security: SQLi/XSS attempts rejected (TC19, TC20).
gaps: Soft Deletes: No tests verify soft-delete semantics (e.g., audit/history shows deleted state vs hard removal).
Unknown customField IDs: No scenario for deleting IDs that do not belong to the account or do not exist; expected idempotent 204 or specific error is unverified.
Mixed validity in query: No test where some customField IDs are valid and some invalid to confirm whole-request validation vs partial success.
Response headers: No assertions for response headers (e.g., Content-Type on 204 should typically be absent; story states produces application/json but 204 has no body).
Authorization specificity: 401 vs 403 distinction not asserted precisely with clear preconditions (TC10 allows either).
Concurrency race realism: No scenario where two users delete overlapping subsets and final state is validated for correctness/idempotency beyond performance SLA.
AccountId validation edges: No tests for valid UUID variants (uppercase/lowercase, hyphenated vs canonical) to ensure acceptance of all compliant formats.
recommendations: Add a scenario to validate soft-delete vs hard-delete behavior (e.g., verify audit logs/history endpoint or deleted flag if applicable).
Add tests for unknown/not-owned customField IDs: all unknown, and a mix of known + unknown, asserting expected status (likely 204 idempotent) and resulting state.
Add a mixed-validity test: include one invalid UUID among valid customField IDs and assert whether the API rejects the request with 400 or ignores invalids; document expected behavior.
Assert response headers: for 204 ensure no Content-Type/body; if server sends headers, verify they align with API contract (produces application/json not applicable for 204 body).
Split authorization tests to explicitly cover 401 (no/invalid auth) vs 403 (authenticated but no permission) with clear setups.
Add a true race-condition scenario: two users delete intersecting sets concurrently; verify final custom fields set is empty or as expected and that both calls return 204.
Include positive UUID format edges (uppercase UUID, canonical vs different hyphenation if accepted) to confirm parser behavior per documented pattern.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/payments - Retrieve account payments

covered_items: Valid Request: Happy-path retrieval with required path param and various valid query params (withAttempts, withPluginInfo, pluginProperty, audit) is well covered (TC01–TC07, TC21–TC22).
Empty Response: Non-existent account and account with no payments return 200 with empty array (TC08, TC09).
Query Parameters: Combinations and edge cases covered, including invalid audit (400), empty/malformed pluginProperty, multiple pluginProperty values, and combined params (TC04–TC07, TC16–TC18).
Authorization: 401 for missing and invalid/expired tokens covered (TC11, TC12).
Input Validation: Invalid accountId format (400), unsupported query param ignored, XSS/injection attempt handled as error (TC10, TC14, TC19).
Service/Dependency Failures: Backend 503 and dependent plugin down behavior covered (TC13, TC23).
Performance/Robustness: Large data volume, concurrent requests, and network timeout scenarios are present (TC15, TC20, TC24).
State Variations: Partially populated payment objects handled (TC25).
gaps: Pagination: No scenarios verifying pagination behavior with large datasets; if endpoint is unpaginated, this should be clarified in the spec; otherwise add tests.
Caching Behavior: No checks for caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control) or conditional requests.
Authorization (403): No scenario for authenticated user lacking permission (403), if applicable to this endpoint.
Response Headers: No validation of Content-Type application/json or other headers specified by the API.
Audit=NONE: Default behavior (NONE) not explicitly tested, nor explicit audit=NONE query.
Default Exclusions: For default withAttempts=false and withPluginInfo=false, tests do not assert absence of attempts/pluginInfo fields (TC01/TC22 assert JSON array but not field absence).
Rate Limiting/Throttling: No scenarios for burst traffic leading to 429 or backoff headers.
Schema Rigor: Tests state "expected fields" but don’t assert required vs optional fields, data types, or enum constraints in depth.
recommendations: Add pagination scenarios (page/limit or next-page mechanisms) or document N/A if endpoint is not paginated; if not paginated, ensure large dataset handling is acceptable and documented.
Add tests to validate caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control) and conditional GET (If-None-Match -> 304) if supported.
Include an authorization test for 403 Forbidden when credentials are valid but lack required permissions (if applicable).
Assert response headers explicitly: Content-Type application/json and any versioning headers.
Add scenarios for audit=NONE (explicit) and default behavior when audit parameter is omitted; verify audit fields are absent/minimized per spec.
Enhance default-path tests to assert absence of paymentAttempts and pluginInfo when withAttempts/withPluginInfo are false or omitted.
Introduce rate limiting tests: simulate rapid consecutive requests and expect 429 with Retry-After if enforced.
Strengthen schema validation: assert required fields, data types, UUID formats, enums (audit), and that optional fields may be null/missing as per schema.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/customFields/{customFieldId}/auditLogsWithHistory - Retrieve custom field audit logs with history by id

covered_items: Valid Request: Successful retrieval returns 200 with application/json and an array of AuditLog objects (TC01).
Empty Response: When no audit logs exist, API returns 200 with an empty JSON array (TC02, TC12).
Authorization: Missing and invalid tokens return 401 with appropriate error messages (TC06, TC07).
Not Found Handling: 404 for non-existent custom field and for orphaned account scenarios (TC03, TC04).
Input Validation: Invalid UUID format, missing path segment, extra path segments, spaces in ID handled with 400/404 (TC05, TC10, TC15, TC17).
Server Error Handling: Backend outage returns 503 with safe error body (TC08).
Security Hardening: SQL injection attempt does not expose internals; returns 400/404 (TC09).
Performance/Scalability: Large result set and concurrent requests validated for timing and correctness (TC11, TC14).
Content-Type/Produces: application/json asserted across success cases (TC01, TC02, TC11, TC12, TC13).
Backward Compatibility: Older User-Agent still yields correct response (TC13).
gaps: Caching Behavior: No scenarios validate ETag/Last-Modified or Cache-Control headers for GET responses.
Rate Limiting: No tests to verify behavior under throttling (e.g., 429 Too Many Requests).
Content Negotiation: No tests for Accept headers (e.g., non-JSON) and expected 406/appropriate fallback.
Response Schema Depth: No explicit verification that "with history" includes expected history details/structure per AuditLog definition (e.g., change entries, who/when, previous values, ordering).
Generic 5xx Handling: Only 503 is covered; no case for unexpected 500 Internal Server Error behavior.
Pagination: Not applicable per story/spec (endpoint returns an array without pagination parameters), but if the API supports pagination implicitly, there are no tests.
recommendations: Add caching tests: assert presence/behavior of ETag or Last-Modified, and Cache-Control on 200 responses; revalidate with If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since to expect 304 when applicable.
Introduce rate limiting tests: burst requests from same principal to confirm correct 429 behavior (if enforced) and headers like Retry-After.
Add content negotiation scenarios: request with Accept: application/xml or */* to verify 406 Not Acceptable or proper JSON default per spec.

Strengthen schema validation: explicitly validate the AuditLog-with-history structure (fields like changeType, changedBy, changedDate, previousValue/newValue, entityId), and ensure chronological ordering.
Include a generic 500 error simulation (e.g., unexpected server exception) to confirm safe error body and headers.

Confirm pagination is truly not applicable: if large datasets are server-paginated, add tests for limit/offset or next links; otherwise, document that the endpoint intentionally returns full arrays without pagination.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/paymentMethods - Add a payment method

covered_items: POST/Valid Payload: Multiple success paths including minimal and maximal payloads (TC01, TC10, TC11), correct 201 status, response body schema, and Location header.
Query Parameters: isDefault, payAllUnpaidInvoices, controlPluginName (multi), and pluginProperty (multi) covered individually and in combination (TC02, TC03, TC04, TC08).
Headers: Required X-Killbill-CreatedBy enforced (TC16); optional X-Killbill-Reason and X-Killbill-Comment exercised (TC05).
Invalid Payload: Malformed JSON (TC12), missing required fields (TC13), unexpected params ignored (TC09).
Validation: Path UUID format (TC14), non-existent account 404 (TC15), injection/XSS validation (TC19, TC20).
Server Error Handling: Plugin inconsistency -> 500 (TC27); downstream service unavailable -> 503 (TC18).
Duplicate Submission/Concurrency: Network retry idempotency and prevention of duplicates (TC21); concurrent requests without duplicates (TC23).
Side-effects semantics: isDefault behavior, payAllUnpaidInvoices attempts, control plugins invocation and plugin properties passed (TC02, TC03, TC04).
Performance: Response time under normal and peak load (TC28, TC29).
Security/Authorization: Unauthorized access returns 401 (TC17).
gaps: Content negotiation and media type: No scenario for missing/incorrect Content-Type or Accept headers (e.g., 415 Unsupported Media Type, 406 Not Acceptable).
Default behavior assertions: No explicit check that isDefault defaults to false when not provided; no check that payAllUnpaidInvoices defaults to false (side effects should not occur).
Query parameter type/format validation: No negative tests for invalid boolean values (e.g., isDefault=yes) or malformed multi-value params leading to 400.
Error body contract: Tests assert status codes but do not verify standardized error schema/fields for 4xx/5xx responses (code, message, type, requestId).
Downstream side-effects verification: payAllUnpaidInvoices only asserts attempts; no validation of outcomes when payments partially fail or are declined, and resulting account/invoice states.
Control plugins edge cases: No test for empty controlPluginName values, duplicate plugin names, or plugin property key-only/duplicate keys behavior.
Auditing: TC05 mentions audit reflection but does not assert audit log retrieval or exact audit fields populated.
Rate limiting/throttling: No test for 429 Too Many Requests under burst traffic (if applicable to POST).
recommendations: Add content negotiation tests: missing Content-Type -> 415; wrong media type (text/plain) -> 415; unacceptable Accept -> 406.
Add explicit default-behavior scenarios: POST without isDefault/payAllUnpaidInvoices and assert default remains unchanged and no auto-pay attempt occurs.
Add negative query param validation: isDefault=foo, payAllUnpaidInvoices=1, malformed multi parameters -> expect 400 with clear error.
Verify standardized error response schema for 400/401/404/500/503 including error code, message, and correlation/request id.
Expand payAllUnpaidInvoices coverage: simulate partial/failed payments; assert invoices updated appropriately, retries, and failure reasons logged without creating duplicate payments.
Cover control plugin edge cases: empty controlPluginName, duplicate plugin names, empty/duplicate pluginProperty keys; assert behavior and errors as specified.
Strengthen auditing checks: after POST with Reason/Comment, GET audit logs and assert exact fields and values.
If applicable, add rate limiting tests for POST to validate 429 handling and Retry-After headers under burst load.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/catalog/versions - Retrieve a list of catalog versions

covered_items: Valid Request: Happy paths verified for global retrieval and tenant-specific via accountId (TC01, TC02), including JSON format and ISO 8601 strings.
Empty Response: Behavior verified when no catalog versions exist and when accountId does not exist (TC03, TC04, TC13).
Query Parameters: accountId exercised with valid, invalid, empty, mixed case, leading/trailing spaces, and unsupported extra params (TC02, TC05, TC09, TC16, TC17, TC18).
Authorization: Unauthenticated and invalid/expired token cases return 401 with appropriate messages (TC06, TC07).
Server/Error Handling: 400, 500, 503, and potential 504 paths covered; malformed JSON, service down, slow dependencies addressed (TC05, TC08, TC11, TC19).
Security Input Validation: SQL injection attempt is rejected without leaking sensitive info (TC12).
Content-Type/Produces: application/json asserted consistently (TC01, TC02, TC20).
Large Dataset Handling: Non-paginated performance and correctness validated at 10,000 items and with concurrency (TC10, TC15).
gaps: Pagination: No scenarios validating pagination mechanics (e.g., limit/offset, page/size), ordering guarantees, or boundaries with large datasets.
Rate Limiting/Throttling: Concurrency is tested (TC15) but no explicit rate-limiting behavior (429) or Retry-After headers validation.
Caching Behavior: No checks for ETag/Last-Modified, Cache-Control, or conditional requests (If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since -> 304).
Authorization Granularity: No test for 403 Forbidden (e.g., authenticated user lacking scope/tenant permission) if applicable to this endpoint.
Response Headers: No validation of standard headers (e.g., Content-Length, Date) or charset in Content-Type.
Deterministic Ordering: No assertion that version dates are consistently ordered (e.g., ascending/descending) if the API contracts this.
recommendations: Add pagination tests: verify default page size, limit/offset (or page/size) parameters, boundary conditions (limit=0, max limit), and stable ordering across pages.
Add rate limiting tests: burst requests to trigger 429, assert Retry-After header, and verify behavior resets after window.
Add caching tests: assert ETag/Last-Modified and Cache-Control on 200 responses; send If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since to validate 304 Not Modified.
Introduce a 403 scenario (if enforced): authenticated user without proper role/tenant access should receive 403.
Verify deterministic ordering of the returned date-time strings and document expected sort order.
Extend header validation: ensure Content-Type includes charset where applicable and basic response headers are sane.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/timeline - Retrieve account timeline

covered_items: GET/Valid Request: Multiple success scenarios with required and optional query parameters (audit NONE/FULL/MINIMAL, parallel=true) returning 200 and valid AccountTimeline JSON.
GET/Empty Response: Scenarios for accounts with no bundles/invoices/payments returning valid empty arrays (TC06, TC17).
GET/Query Parameters: Comprehensive coverage of valid combinations and invalid values (unsupported values -> 400, unsupported params ignored, combined params).
GET/Authorization: Missing and invalid tokens yield 401 (TC10, TC11).
GET/Error Handling: 400 for malformed UUID and injection payloads, 404 for non-existent account, 500 for DB failure, 503 for service down, 504 timeout behavior covered (TC08, TC09, TC13, TC12, TC25).
Performance/Concurrency: Large dataset response time and concurrent requests thresholds validated (TC07, TC20).
Defaults: Implicit verification of audit default NONE when no query params provided (TC01).
Security/Robustness: SQLi/XSS inputs rejected without leakage (TC14, TC15).
Regression safeguards: Known past issues for audit=FULL invoices and parallel=true partial data (TC21, TC22).
gaps: GET/Pagination: No scenarios verify pagination or explicitly assert non-paginated behavior with large datasets and how clients should handle it.
GET/Rate Limiting: No coverage for throttling or 429 Too Many Requests under burst traffic.
GET/Caching Behavior: No validation of caching headers (ETag/Last-Modified, Cache-Control) or conditional requests (If-None-Match -> 304).
GET/Response Headers: No explicit checks for Content-Type application/json and charset; no Accept header negotiation behavior.
GET/Authorization (Forbidden): No scenario for authenticated but unauthorized/insufficient permissions (403) if applicable.
GET/Default parameter behavior: No explicit test for parallel default=false behavior or explicit parallel=false query parameter.
GET/Schema validation depth: Tests do not validate the full AccountTimeline schema (required fields, data types, array element structure) beyond high-level presence.
Input validation nuances: No tests for whitespace, uppercase/lowercase UUID handling beyond casing of query param name; no tests for trailing/leading spaces or URL-encoded characters in accountId.
Observability of parallel=true: Verification relies on logs/perf; no deterministic assertion (e.g., instrumentation flag or header) to prove parallelization.
Backward compatibility/casing: Behavior for Audit=FULL left ambiguous (200 or 400) without asserting expected spec outcome.
Internationalization/Localization of error messages: Not validated (e.g., stable error codes vs. human-readable text).
recommendations: Add pagination tests: if unsupported, assert that all items are returned in one page and document absence of pagination; if supported, verify links, limits, offsets, and boundary conditions.
Introduce rate-limiting tests: send bursts to trigger 429, verify Retry-After header, and graceful recovery after backoff.
Add caching tests: verify ETag/Last-Modified and Cache-Control on 200; send If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since to assert 304 behavior and correct validators.
Assert response headers: check Content-Type application/json; optionally test Accept negotiation and error Content-Type consistency.
Add 403 scenario: authenticated user lacking access to the account should get 403 (if the API enforces ownership/role-based access).
Test defaults explicitly: send parallel=false and audit omitted; verify audit defaults to NONE and that parallel=false is honored (define observable signal or server header).
Deep schema validation: validate required fields and types for account, bundles, invoices, payments against the AccountTimeline definition, including empty vs. missing fields.
Expand input validation: test trimmed/URL-encoded accountIds, uppercase UUIDs, leading/trailing spaces, and mixed-case handling; ensure consistent 400 behavior.
Strengthen parallel verification: agree on a deterministic indicator (e.g., X-Parallel-Processing: true) or server metric to assert parallel execution in tests.
Resolve casing compatibility: decide expected outcome for Audit=FULL and assert it; if unsupported, ensure 400 with clear error; if supported, treat as case-insensitive and return 200.
Stabilize error contract: validate presence of machine-readable error codes/keys to avoid locale-dependent assertions for messages.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/bundles - Retrieve bundles for account

covered_items: Valid Request: Successful 200 responses with correct JSON array of Bundle objects, including combined query params.
Empty Response: Account with no bundles returns 200 and empty array.
Query Parameters: externalKey, bundlesFilter, and audit (FULL/MINIMAL) covered individually and in combination; invalid audit value handled (400).
Authorization: Unauthorized request covered with 401.
Path/Resource Errors: 400 for malformed accountId and 404 for non-existent account covered.
Default Audit Behavior: Verified that audit info is not included by default (audit=NONE by default).
Schema/Contract: Response conforms to Bundle definition (and documentation check).
gaps: Pagination: No scenarios for pagination handling with large datasets (e.g., page/limit, next links) or explicit confirmation that pagination is not supported.
Rate Limiting: No tests for throttling behavior (e.g., burst requests leading to 429 and Retry-After).
Caching Behavior: No validation of ETag/Last-Modified, Cache-Control, or conditional requests (If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since) resulting in 304.
Content Negotiation/Headers: No checks for Content-Type: application/json header or Accept header handling (e.g., unsupported media types).
Audit=NONE explicitly: No scenario explicitly passing audit=NONE to confirm parity with default behavior.
Filter No-Match Cases: No test for externalKey/bundlesFilter that match nothing returning 200 with empty array.
Error Body Contract: Error payload structure (fields/code/message) not validated against a standard error schema for 400/404.
recommendations: Add pagination tests (or an explicit scenario stating pagination is not supported). If supported, cover page/size, boundaries, next/prev links, and large datasets over multiple pages.
Add rate limiting scenarios: rapid-fire requests leading to 429 with Retry-After header; verify standard headers and recovery after backoff.
Add caching tests: capture ETag on first call, reissue with If-None-Match to expect 304; verify Cache-Control/ETag/Last-Modified presence and correctness.
Verify headers and content negotiation: check Content-Type=application/json; send an unsupported Accept to verify 406 or negotiated response.
Add a scenario explicitly using audit=NONE and confirm identical output to default.
Add negative filter scenarios where externalKey/bundlesFilter yields no results and confirm 200 with empty array.
Validate error response schema for 400 and 404 (consistent fields, codes, messages) to ensure client compatibility.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/auditLogs - Retrieve audit logs by account id

covered_items: Valid Request: Successful retrieval with 200 and JSON array for existing account (TC01, TC07, TC09, TC13, TC14).
Empty Response: 200 with empty array when no audit logs (TC02, TC12).
Authorization: 401 for missing/invalid token (TC05, TC06).
Error Handling: 404 when account not found (TC03); 400/422 for invalid/empty accountId (TC04, TC15); 500 on system failure (TC08); 503/504 on timeout (TC11).
Robustness/Security: Injection-like input rejected as invalid (TC10).
Content Negotiation basics: Content-Type application/json verified on success (TC01, TC02).
Performance/Load sanity: Large dataset and response time check; concurrent requests stability (TC09, TC14).
gaps: Pagination: No scenarios for paging large result sets (page number/size, next/prev, limits).
Rate Limiting/Throttling: No tests for exceeding request thresholds or 429 responses with Retry-After.
Caching Behavior: No validation of ETag/Last-Modified/Cache-Control headers or conditional GET (If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since -> 304).
Authorization depth: No 403 scenario for authenticated but unauthorized user/insufficient scope.
Query Parameters breadth: Only extraneous param tested; no coverage for any documented/standard params if applicable (e.g., audit level/filtering) or explicit rejection/handling.
Response schema rigor: "AuditLog" object fields are not strictly validated for types/formats (e.g., UUIDs, timestamps, enums).
Headers/negotiation: No Accept header variants or charset handling; no negative test for unsupported media types (406).
Error response contract: No checks for standard error schema (code, message, details, correlationId).
recommendations: Add pagination scenarios: valid page/size, boundary values (size=0, very large size), navigating multiple pages, and invalid values (negative, non-numeric) with expected errors.
Introduce rate limiting tests: burst above threshold and verify 429 Too Many Requests and Retry-After header; ensure normal load is unaffected.
Add caching tests: verify ETag/Last-Modified and Cache-Control on 200; perform conditional GET with If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since to assert 304 and no body.
Expand authorization coverage: role/scope-based 403 when token lacks permission; verify 401 vs 403 distinction.

Broaden query parameter coverage based on API spec (if any params exist for filtering or audit level). If none are supported, add a scenario asserting that unknown params are ignored or rejected consistently.
Strengthen schema validation: assert full AuditLog schema (required fields, data types, timestamp formats, enum/domain values) and reject extra/unknown fields if the contract requires.
Validate error payload structure: assert presence and correctness of fields like errorCode, message, and optional details/correlationId across 4xx/5xx.
Add content negotiation tests: send Accept: application/json (success) and unsupported media type to assert 406 Not Acceptable if applicable.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/invoicePayments/{paymentId}/tags - Retrieve payment tags

covered_items: Valid Request: Multiple happy-path scenarios with/without query params return 200 and JSON array.
Empty Response: Case for payments with no tags returns 200 and empty array.
Query Parameters: includedDeleted (true/default), pluginProperty (multi), audit (FULL/MINIMAL), combined params, invalid audit value.
Path Parameter Validation: Invalid UUID pattern returns 400; non-existent payment returns 404.
Authorization: Missing auth returns 401.
Error Handling: 500 and 503 scenarios covered with appropriate messaging.
Content-Type: application/json asserted on success.
Security: SQL injection-like paymentId and XSS in pluginProperty handled safely.
Performance/Large Data: Heavy load and maximum tags payload scenarios validate responsiveness and completeness.
Resilience: Transient network failure and retry behavior validated.
Robustness: Extra/unexpected query parameters are ignored successfully.
gaps: Authorization: No test for 403 Forbidden (authenticated but not authorized).
Audit Defaults/Behavior: No explicit test that default audit=NONE returns no audit fields; limited verification of exact contents for MINIMAL vs FULL.
Caching Behavior: No scenarios checking ETag/Last-Modified, Cache-Control headers, or conditional GET (If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since).
Rate Limiting/Throttling: No tests for 429 or backoff headers under burst traffic.
Error Body Schema: No validation of standardized error payload shape/fields for 400/404/500/503 cases.
Content Negotiation: No tests for Accept header variants or charset; only Content-Type on success in one case.
Pagination: Not addressed; if the endpoint does paginate for large tag sets, coverage is missing (confirm N/A if pagination is unsupported).
recommendations: Add a 403 Forbidden scenario for a user lacking permission to view tags for a payment.
Add scenarios to verify audit=NONE default (no audit info present) and to assert precise differences between audit=MINIMAL and audit=FULL per spec.
Introduce caching tests: presence/values of ETag and Cache-Control, and conditional GET returning 304 Not Modified.
Add rate limiting tests: send bursts to trigger 429, validate Retry-After and proper handling.
Validate standardized error response schema (fields like code, message, type, requestId) for 400/404/500/503.
Extend header tests: assert Content-Type (with charset) and support for Accept header (e.g., application/json) including rejection of unsupported media types (406).
Clarify pagination applicability: if supported, add page/limit param tests and large dataset navigation; if not, document as N/A and ensure responses include all tags.
Add negative pluginProperty tests: unsupported types/values, excessive length per entry, and behavior when N+1 exceeds limit.
Include a scenario verifying default includedDeleted=false explicitly omits deleted tags even when they exist.
Add idempotent GET caching/performance combo: repeated requests return 304 with ETag and maintain performance under cache hits.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/invoiceItems/{invoiceItemId}/customFields - Add custom fields to invoice item

covered_items: POST | Valid Payload: Multiple happy-path scenarios validate 201 with correct JSON array response (TC01–TC04) and optional headers behavior (TC01, TC02).
POST | Invalid Payload: Malformed JSON, missing body, invalid UUID format, and missing required header return 400 as specified (TC06–TC09).
POST | Validation: Field-level validations explored via lengths, special characters, injection attempts, and duplicate names behavior is checked (TC17, TC19–TC21).
POST | Large Payloads: Maximum-size array handling is exercised and expected 201/413 outcomes considered (TC14).
POST | Authorization: Unauthorized/forbidden access covered with 401/403 expectations (TC12).
POST | Duplicate Submission: Retries under transient network failure ensure no duplication (idempotent outcome) (TC25).
Error Scenarios per story: 404 for non-existent invoice item IDs (TC05, TC22, TC23) and 400 for malformed body/invalid ID (TC06, TC08, TC09).
Resilience/Concurrency: Concurrent POSTs to same resource and degraded performance response-time expectations are covered (TC16, TC24).
Persistence/Integration: Verifies created custom fields are retrievable via follow-up GET (TC18).
gaps: POST | Server Error Handling: No explicit 500 Internal Server Error simulation (e.g., DB failure) per guidelines; only 503 is covered (TC13).
POST | Unsupported Media Type: No scenario for wrong/missing Content-Type header expecting 415.
Content Negotiation/Headers: No assertions for response Content-Type=application/json per “Produces”; no Accept header handling (e.g., 406) checks.
Schema Validation Depth: No tests for required/missing fields within CustomField objects, invalid data types, or enum/format constraints defined by #/definitions/CustomField.
Deterministic Expectations: Several tests allow multiple outcomes (e.g., 201 or 400 in TC11, TC14, TC17, TC19–TC21) instead of asserting the product’s expected behavior.
Duplicate Submission (non-retry): No explicit test for exact duplicate POST submitted twice (without network failure) and expected idempotency/duplication behavior.
Validation of Empty Array Contract: TC10 assumes 201 with empty array but the story doesn’t define behavior; needs explicit expected result and contract verification.
Concurrency Outcomes: TC16 does not assert specific expected status codes (e.g., 201 vs 409) or final state guarantees (ordering, deduplication).
recommendations: Add a server-failure scenario that triggers a 500 Internal Server Error (e.g., simulate DB outage) and assert proper error body and headers.
Add tests for 415 Unsupported Media Type by sending Content-Type other than application/json and by omitting Content-Type.
Assert response headers per contract: Content-Type=application/json; optionally verify charset and absence/presence of Location/ETag if applicable.
Strengthen schema validation: include cases for missing required fields in CustomField, invalid data types, out-of-range values, and any enum constraints from the schema.

Replace ambiguous “201 or 400/413” outcomes with concrete expected behavior aligned with API spec for: extra fields (TC11), large payload (TC14), duplicates (TC17), boundary lengths (TC19), special chars (TC20), injection (TC21).

Add a pure duplicate submission test: POST the exact same payload twice to the same invoice item and assert the defined idempotency/duplication behavior (e.g., second call 200/201 with no duplicates, or 409 if rejected).
Clarify and assert the product decision for empty arrays (TC10): whether 201 with empty array, 204, or 400; update test accordingly.
Refine concurrency test (TC16): define expected outcomes (e.g., all 201, or some 409 on conflict) and verify final persisted state for correctness and absence of duplicates.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/invoiceItems/{invoiceItemId}/customFields - Modify custom fields to invoice item

covered_items: PUT - Valid Request: Multiple success scenarios validate 204 status and data updated (TC01–TC05).
PUT - Non-Existing Resource: Proper 404 handling for missing invoice items (TC07, TC24, TC25).
Robust input validation: Invalid UUID (TC06), malformed JSON (TC08), empty body (TC10), unsupported fields (TC11).
Headers: Required X-Killbill-CreatedBy enforced and validated; optional headers exercised (TC02, TC03, TC09).
Authentication/Authorization: 401 for invalid/missing token (TC13).
Error handling: 400/404/500/503/504 responses validated for varied failure modes (TC06–TC11, TC15–TC16, TC19).
Idempotency: Repeated same PUT yields consistent state (TC17).
Performance/Scale: Parallel requests and large payloads covered (TC20, TC21).
Security validation: Injection-like payloads handled with 400/422 (TC14).
Edge/URL handling: Unexpected query parameter behavior exercised (TC23).
gaps: PUT - Partial Update semantics: No scenarios confirm whether partial updates are allowed or must be rejected; behavior when sending only a subset vs full replacement is not defined/tested.
PUT - Concurrency Issues on the same resource: No tests for simultaneous updates to the same invoice item (e.g., race conditions, last-write-wins, versioning/ETag).
Content-Type/Accept headers: No test enforcing Content-Type: application/json or behavior for incorrect/missing Content-Type and Accept negotiation.
Empty array vs empty body: No scenario for a valid empty JSON array [] to intentionally clear all custom fields (if supported) or reject it (if not).
Schema-level validation breadth: No tests for invalid field names/keys, null/empty values, duplicate fields, or value length/format constraints per CustomField schema.
Audit header behavior: No verification that Reason/Comment are persisted/audited when provided.
Response headers: No verification of standard headers (e.g., Content-Type on errors, correlation/request-id) and no body verification on 204 (ensuring truly no body).
Rate limiting/throttling: No scenarios for too many requests leading to 429 (if applicable).
recommendations: Define and add scenarios for partial update semantics: clearly specify whether the PUT replaces the entire set of custom fields or supports partial updates; add tests to assert acceptance or rejection accordingly.

Add concurrency tests on the same invoice item: two or more concurrent PUTs with different payloads, and if supported, include optimistic locking/version headers; assert deterministic outcome and proper error (e.g., 409) or last-write policy.
Add Content-Type/Accept tests: incorrect/missing Content-Type should return 415/400; unsupported Accept should return 406; correct headers should pass.
Clarify and test empty JSON array [] behavior: if it clears all fields, add success case; if disallowed, assert specific error.
Expand schema validation: invalid key names, null/empty values, duplicates, out-of-range lengths, and invalid types per CustomField definition; include 400/422 expectations.
Verify audit propagation: when Reason/Comment provided, assert they are stored/logged in audit records; when omitted, ensure defaults.
Validate response headers: ensure no body on 204; assert Content-Type on error responses and presence of correlation/request-id headers if standard.
Consider rate limiting tests (if platform-enforced): burst PUTs resulting in 429 and proper Retry-After handling.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/bundles/{bundleId}/customFields - Modify custom fields to bundle

covered_items: PUT - Valid Request: Multiple success paths with 204 on valid payloads (TC01, TC02, TC13-15, TC22-25).
Optional Headers: X-Killbill-Reason and X-Killbill-Comment exercised alongside required header (TC02).
Required Header Validation: Missing X-Killbill-CreatedBy returns 400 (TC06).
Path Param Validation: Invalid bundleId format returns 400 (TC04).
Non-Existing Resource: 404 when bundle not found (TC05).
Request Body Validation: Malformed JSON (TC07), missing body (TC08), extra unsupported fields (TC09).
State Variations: No existing fields, existing fields, partial overlap/update (TC22-TC24).
Security/Negative: SQL injection-like payload handled (TC12).
Operational Errors: 500/503 error handling scenarios included (TC11, TC20).
Authorization: 401 unauthorized path covered (TC10).
Performance/Load: Normal and peak load behavior assessed (TC17, TC18).
Edge Behaviors: Empty array to remove all fields, max counts/lengths, special characters (TC03, TC13-15, TC19).
gaps: PUT Guideline - Concurrency: No explicit race-condition tests on the same bundle to verify update ordering or conflict handling beyond load; no versioning/ETag semantics tested.
Partial Update Semantics: Story does not define whether partial updates are allowed; suite assumes they are (TC24). Need tests to enforce/reject partial updates per contract.
Content-Type/Accept Handling: No tests asserting Content-Type: application/json is required or behavior with incorrect media type (e.g., 415), nor Accept header negotiation.
Response Headers/Produces: Story lists produces application/json, but tests do not verify response headers; for 204, verify no response body and appropriate headers.

CustomField Schema Validation Depth: No tests for missing required fields within CustomField objects, invalid data types, invalid key/name formats, nulls, duplicates within the array, or key/value length/range constraints beyond max length value.
UUID Pattern Nuance: Only a blatantly invalid ID is tested; no boundary formats (uppercase/lowercase hex, hyphen-less UUIDs, too long/short) to ensure strict pattern enforcement.
Authorization Variants: 403/permission-based access not covered (only 401).
Idempotency: No test to confirm repeated identical PUTs are idempotent and do not create duplicates or side effects.
Large/Over-limit Payloads: No test for payload exceeding allowed limits (e.g., 413 or 400 when array size/value lengths exceed limits).
Auditability: No assertions that X-Killbill-Reason/Comment are persisted to audit logs or change history.
recommendations: Add concurrency tests: two or more simultaneous PUTs on the same bundle with differing payloads; define and verify expected outcome (last-write-wins or version conflict).
Clarify and test partial update rules: if partial updates are not allowed, add a negative test expecting 400/409; if allowed, document and verify exact merge semantics.
Add media-type tests: incorrect Content-Type (text/plain) should return 415; assert Content-Type requirements and Accept handling.
Verify response headers for 204: assert no body and appropriate headers; if produces application/json is mandated, clarify for 204 and assert accordingly.

Deep schema validation: add cases for missing required fields in CustomField, invalid types, null/empty keys when disallowed, duplicate keys in array, exceeding per-field length constraints, invalid characters, and unknown custom field names when constrained.
Expand UUID validation: test edge formats (upper/lower case, extra/missing hyphens, length off-by-one, non-hex chars) to ensure strict regex enforcement.
Authorization coverage: add 403 scenario for authenticated user lacking permission/role to modify bundle custom fields.
Idempotency check: issue the same PUT twice and assert the second returns 204 with no changes and no duplicate data.
Over-limit payloads: test arrays larger than maximum allowed and values longer than limits, expecting 400/413 as per API contract.
Audit trail verification: after a successful update with Reason/Comment, query audit logs (or headers) to confirm they are recorded.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: DELETE /1.0/kb/invoiceItems/{invoiceItemId}/customFields - Remove custom fields from invoice item

covered_items: DELETE - Valid Deletion: Success paths for deleting all fields (no query) and specific fields (with query) return 204 and clear fields (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC06).
DELETE - Non-Existent Resource: 404 when invoice item does not exist (TC08).
DELETE - Server Error Handling: Dependency/service unavailable returns 503 (TC14).
Authorization: 401 for invalid/expired auth token (TC19).
Input Validation - Path Params: 400 for invalid invoiceItemId format (TC07).
Input Validation - Query Params: 400 for malformed customField IDs and mixed valid/invalid IDs (TC10, TC17); duplicates tolerated (TC18); extra unexpected params are ignored (TC11).
Headers: Required X-Killbill-CreatedBy enforced (TC09); optional headers covered including Reason and Comment with long value (TC05, TC16); regression on header parsing (TC20).
Scalability: Large number of customField IDs handled (TC12).
Operational/Performance: Under load still returns 204 within acceptable response time (TC13).
Idempotency-like behavior: Deleting when no custom fields exists still returns 204 (TC04).
gaps: DELETE - Concurrency: No scenarios where two clients delete simultaneously or where a delete occurs between request and processing (race conditions).
DELETE - Soft Deletes/Audit: No verification that deletions are soft or recorded in audit logs/history (if applicable in Kill Bill).
Authorization Variants: No 403 Forbidden scenario (valid auth but insufficient permissions/roles).
Idempotency on specific IDs: No test for repeating the same specific-ID deletion twice and ensuring the second call behavior (e.g., 204 or defined error).
Validation - Non-associated IDs: No scenario where provided customField UUIDs are valid format but do not belong to the target invoice item (should they be ignored, 400, or partial success?).
Empty/missing query parameter edge: No explicit test for customField parameter present but empty (e.g., customField= with no value) and multiple repeated empty params.
Headers - Limits/Validation: No max length/character set validation for X-Killbill-CreatedBy and X-Killbill-Reason; only Comment length was tested.
Content Negotiation/Headers: No checks for expected response headers (Content-Type for 204, error payload structure/content-type), nor Accept handling.
Rate Limiting/Throttling: No tests for too many DELETE requests leading to 429 or similar behavior if enforced.
recommendations: Add concurrency scenarios: two parallel DELETEs against the same invoice item; verify final state and expected response codes.
Define and test soft delete/audit expectations: assert audit entries or history endpoints reflect deletions if Kill Bill tracks them.
Add authorization coverage for 403 Forbidden with a valid token lacking necessary permissions/tenant roles.
Test idempotency for specific-ID deletions: perform DELETE with the same customField IDs twice; define expected behavior (likely 204 both times).
Add scenario where customField UUIDs are valid but not associated to the invoice item; clarify expected outcome (ignore vs 400) and test it.
Add edge case for empty customField parameters (e.g., customField=, customField=&customField=) and mixed empty + valid values.
Extend header validation: boundaries and invalid characters for X-Killbill-CreatedBy and X-Killbill-Reason; test overly long Reason.
Validate response headers: ensure 204 has no body and appropriate headers; for errors, assert structured JSON error with proper Content-Type and fields.
If applicable, include rate limiting tests (burst of DELETEs) to verify 429 or system-defined behavior.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: DELETE /1.0/kb/invoicePayments/{paymentId}/customFields - Remove custom fields from payment

covered_items: DELETE - Valid Deletion: Successful 204 when removing all fields (no query param) and specific fields (multi query params).
DELETE - Non-Existent Resource: 404 when paymentId does not exist.
Input Validation: 400 for invalid paymentId format; 400 for malformed customField UUID; 400 when required header X-Killbill-CreatedBy is missing.
Optional Headers: Presence of X-Killbill-Reason and X-Killbill-Comment validated without affecting success (204).
Query Parameters: Multi-valued customField handled; scenarios for one, many, maximum-sized lists; behavior when customField values do not exist is exercised.
Security/Hardening: XSS in header and SQLi-like customField param rejected with 400/422.
Service Reliability: 503 when service unavailable; performance under load scenario included.
Integration: Audit log dependency scenario covered (available/unavailable).
Authorization: 401 for invalid authentication token (beyond story but valuable).
gaps: DELETE - Concurrency: No scenarios for race conditions (simultaneous deletions or delete while another operation modifies custom fields).
DELETE - Soft Deletes: No verification of soft-deletion semantics (e.g., audit/state flags vs. permanent removal) if applicable.
Contract Details: No assertion of response headers such as Content-Type (produces application/json) for 204 responses, or lack thereof, and no validation of error response schema/body shape.
Idempotency: No test confirming repeated DELETE calls yield consistent results (e.g., second call still 204 and no side effects).

Query Param Edge Cases: No scenarios for empty customField parameter, duplicate IDs in query, mixed valid/invalid with partial-success behavior as per spec (current tests assume full 400 on any invalid).
Header Edge Cases: No tests for max length/character set for X-Killbill-CreatedBy/Reason/Comment, or unsupported/extra headers handling beyond one unexpected query param case.
Auditing Guarantees: While audit integration is tested, there is no explicit verification that audit entries include CreatedBy/Reason/Comment correctly.
Rate Limiting/Throttling: No scenarios for fast repeated DELETE requests and expected status (e.g., 429) if enforced by the platform.
Error Spectrum: No tests for 500-class server errors beyond 503 (e.g., DB failure), and no retry behavior validation if applicable.
recommendations: Add concurrency scenarios: two clients deleting the same set of custom fields simultaneously; delete while another request adds/removes a field; ensure atomicity and final state correctness.

Clarify and test soft vs hard delete semantics; if soft delete is expected, assert flags/audit reflect deletion while data remains non-functional; if hard delete, verify fields are not retrievable afterward.
Assert response headers and content-negotiation contract: verify Content-Type (or its absence) on 204; verify error responses include consistent JSON structure with code/message.
Add idempotency test: repeat the same DELETE request and confirm 204 (or defined behavior) and no adverse effects.

Extend query param edge cases: empty customField parameter, duplicate IDs, whitespace, case sensitivity, and confirm defined behavior; add a test for mixed valid/invalid where spec defines whether to reject all or delete valids.
Expand header validation: boundary tests for length, allowed characters, and trimming behavior for X-Killbill-CreatedBy/Reason/Comment; verify extraneous headers are ignored safely.
Enhance audit verification: assert that audit entries capture CreatedBy, Reason, and Comment exactly as sent and are created once per operation.
Consider rate limiting/throttling scenarios if applicable to this endpoint (multiple rapid DELETEs leading to 429 or logged warnings).
Add server-error simulation (e.g., DB outage) to verify 500 handling and consistent error payloads; if retries/backoff are part of client behavior, validate those.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/customFields - Modify custom fields to account

covered_items: PUT - Valid Request: Multiple success scenarios validate 204 update behavior with required and optional headers (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC24).
PUT - Non-Existing Resource: Proper 400 handling when account does not exist (TC07).
PUT - Concurrency Issues: Concurrent updates with data consistency asserted (TC25).
Input Validation: UUID format invalid -> 400 (TC06); missing body -> 400 (TC09); malformed JSON -> 400 (TC10); invalid schema -> 400 (TC11); mixed valid/invalid objects -> 400 (TC18).
Headers: Required X-Killbill-CreatedBy enforced (TC08); optional Reason/Comment supported (TC02); unsupported headers ignored (TC05).
Security/Validation Hardening: SQLi and XSS payloads rejected (TC20, TC21); duplicate field names rejected (TC23); extra properties ignored (TC17); max lengths accepted (TC16).
Operational/Failure Modes: 401 for missing auth (TC12); 503 service down (TC13); 502 dependency failure (TC14); 504 timeout (TC19); 413 large payload limit handling (TC26).
Integration/Auditability: Audit log recorded (TC27); external reporting consistency (TC28).
Edge Cases: Empty array semantics covered (removes all fields) (TC15); large arrays handled (TC04).
gaps: PUT - Partial Update rules/atomicity: No test asserts that partial updates are rejected or that the operation is atomic (i.e., no changes applied if any object is invalid). TC18 reports invalid items but does not verify no partial persistence.
Idempotency of PUT: No scenario verifies that sending the same payload repeatedly results in the same state and response (no duplicates or drift).
Response headers/content-type: The story notes produces application/json; tests don’t verify Content-Type/Accept behavior (especially on 204 vs error responses) or absence of body for 204.
UUID pattern realism: Positive-path examples use non-UUID literals like "valid-uuid-1234-..."; no test validates a correctly formatted UUID against the documented pattern.

Error contract consistency: The story explicitly lists 400 for invalid accountId or malformed body; tests include 502/503/504/413 without asserting error body schema or headers (e.g., correlation ID), and do not confirm correct 400 error payload schema for spec-listed cases.
Atomic removal semantics: TC15 assumes empty array removes all fields; the story does not specify this behavior. Missing a test tied to explicit requirement or product decision for this behavior.
Concurrency control headers/versioning: No scenarios for optimistic concurrency (e.g., If-Match/ETag) or last-writer-wins policy if applicable.
Rate limiting/throttling: No test for 429 or behavior under burst traffic beyond correctness (TC25 focuses on success/consistency, not throttling).
Audit/trace headers: While audit log integration is tested, there is no verification that Reason/Comment propagate into audit records when supplied.
Negative header validation: No tests for invalid types/oversized values in X-Killbill-* headers or disallowed characters.
recommendations: Add an atomicity test: craft a payload with one invalid CustomField and assert the API returns 400 and that no changes were applied to any custom field for the account.
Add PUT idempotency tests: send the same payload multiple times and verify repeated 204s with no duplicate or unintended changes.
Validate response headers: assert Content-Type for error responses, absence of body for 204, and any standard headers (e.g., correlation/request ID) if required by API standards.
Use real RFC-4122 UUIDs in positive paths and add a test that a valid UUID passes the documented pattern check.

Align error contract: for 400 cases (invalid accountId, malformed body), assert error schema fields (code, message, details). Optionally scope or remove non-specified 5xx/413 tests or add assertions to meet documented error contract.

Clarify and formalize empty array behavior with product/engineers; if intended to remove all fields, keep TC15 and add explicit post-condition verification. If not, add a test expecting 400 or no-op per spec.
Add concurrency control tests if supported: ETag/If-Match precondition failures (412) or last-write-wins scenarios documented; otherwise document that such controls are not supported.
Add rate limiting tests: burst PUTs to trigger 429 and verify Retry-After behavior, if the platform enforces throttling.
Extend audit validation: when Reason/Comment are provided, assert they appear in audit logs and/or response headers as designed.
Harden header validation: add tests for overly long X-Killbill-* values, invalid characters, and ensure proper 400 responses with descriptive messages.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/catalog - Retrieve the catalog as JSON

covered_items: Valid Request: Happy paths covered for no params, requestedDate, accountId, and both combined (TC01–TC04, TC16, TC17).
Empty Response: No catalog and no catalog for requested date return appropriate errors (TC05, TC06).
Query Parameters: Broad coverage of valid/invalid formats, combinations, unsupported params, and edge dates (TC02, TC03, TC04, TC07, TC08, TC11, TC16, TC17, TC15).
Authorization: Missing and invalid tokens return 401 as expected (TC09, TC10).
Error Handling: Clear coverage for 400/404/503/504 and input validation (TC05–TC08, TC14, TC15, TC22).
Performance/Robustness: Large datasets, concurrent requests, very large payloads, transient network retry (TC12, TC13, TC18, TC21).
Response Contract: Content-Type and basic schema validity checked (TC01, TC23).
gaps: Pagination: No scenarios for pagination behavior with large result sets (e.g., page/limit, next links) if applicable.
Rate Limiting: No tests for throttling/429 responses or rate-limit headers under burst traffic.
Caching Behavior: No verification of ETag/Last-Modified/Cache-Control, conditional requests (If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since), or 304 responses.
Authorization (Forbidden): No scenario for authenticated but unauthorized access (403), e.g., cross-tenant accountId access.
Account Not Found: No test for valid UUID that does not correspond to any account, clarifying expected status (404 vs 200 vs 400).
Error Payload Contract: No checks that error responses conform to a documented error schema (code, message, details, correlationId).
Content Negotiation: No test asserting Accept header handling and correct response to unsupported media types (e.g., 406).
recommendations: Add pagination tests: large dataset with page/limit parameters, verify total counts, navigation links, and boundary pages. If pagination is not supported, add a negative test to assert absence and document behavior.
Add rate limiting tests: burst concurrent requests to trigger 429; verify Retry-After and rate-limit headers; ensure normal throughput remains 200.
Add caching tests: capture ETag/Last-Modified on first 200 response, re-request with If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since to expect 304; verify Cache-Control directives.
Add 403 authorization scenario: authenticated user attempting to access a catalog via accountId from another tenant or lacking scope; expect 403.
Add scenario for non-existent accountId (valid UUID not present): define and verify expected behavior (likely 404) for both with/without requestedDate.
Validate error contract: assert error JSON schema fields (e.g., code, message, type, requestId) across 400/401/403/404/503/504 cases.
Include Accept header tests: request application/json explicitly and unsupported types to expect 406 or appropriate fallback; confirm Produces header behavior.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/payments - Trigger a payment (authorization, purchase or credit)

covered_items: POST - Valid Payload: Multiple success scenarios (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC16, TC18, TC24) assert 201, JSON body (Payment), and Location header.
POST - Invalid Payload: Malformed body, unsupported currency, extra params, and missing required header handled (TC06, TC09, TC15, TC19).
POST - Large Payloads: Large/max payload and value boundaries covered (TC05, TC17).
POST - Validation: UUID format, required/optional headers, currency, ranges, and default behavior validated (TC01, TC02, TC07, TC16–TC19).
Authorization: Missing/invalid auth token returns 401 (TC20).
Story-specific error codes: 400, 402, 404, 422, 502, 503, 504 all exercised (TC07–TC14).
Query parameters: paymentMethodId usage and defaulting, controlPluginName and pluginProperty (including multi) covered (TC01–TC03, TC24).
Headers: Required X-Killbill-CreatedBy and optional Reason/Comment covered (TC01, TC02, TC06).
Concurrency/duplicate risk: Concurrent requests test system consistency (TC22).
Resilience: Degraded dependencies and timeouts map to correct 5xx codes (TC12–TC14, TC23).
gaps: POST - Duplicate Submission: No explicit scenario for submitting the exact same request twice (idempotency/dedup behavior and expected status).
POST - Server Error Handling (500): No test simulating internal server/database failure returning 500.
Query parameter validation: No case for invalid or non-existent paymentMethodId (e.g., wrong UUID format or paymentMethodId not on the account).
Plugin parameter validation: No test for unknown controlPluginName or invalid pluginProperty format/type.
Request headers/content negotiation: No test for missing/incorrect Content-Type (e.g., 415) or invalid Accept header.
Schema-specific validation: No scenario enumerating required PaymentTransaction fields per schema (e.g., missing amount or transactionType) with precise error responses.
recommendations: Add an idempotency/duplicate submission test: send the same PaymentTransaction twice (with/without an Idempotency-Key if supported) and assert expected behavior (e.g., second call returns same resource or a specific status without duplicating the payment).
Introduce a 500 Internal Server Error scenario by simulating a backend/storage failure and assert proper error body and retry guidance.
Add tests for paymentMethodId validation: invalid UUID format (400), valid UUID not belonging to account (404 or 400 per API contract), and non-existent payment method.
Add plugin validation cases: unknown controlPluginName leading to 422 (or defined error), invalid pluginProperty key/value format, and conflicting plugin properties.
Add content negotiation tests: missing/incorrect Content-Type (expect 415), unsupported Accept header (406 if applicable).

Expand schema validation: explicitly test missing amount, invalid numeric ranges/precision, missing/invalid transactionType (authorization/purchase/credit), and currency-case sensitivity with exact error details.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/bundles/{bundleId}/block - Block a bundle

covered_items: POST - Valid Payload: Multiple success scenarios (required-only, all optionals, headers-only, query-only) verify 201 and response body as array of BlockingState objects.
POST - Invalid Payload: Malformed/missing body (TC08, TC10), invalid data types/format (invalid UUID TC06, invalid requestedDate TC11) return 400.
Path/Query/Header validation: Required header X-Killbill-CreatedBy enforced (TC09), optional headers and query params handled (TC02, TC03, TC04).
404 Not Found: Non-existent bundle and empty system return 404 (TC05, TC07).
Large Payloads: Handled with size limit expectations (TC16).
Validation breadth: Min/max field lengths, partial input (required-only), and special characters are exercised (TC13, TC14, TC15, TC23).
Security robustness: Injection/XSS inputs do not echo back unsanitized content (TC19, TC20).

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/invoicePayments - Trigger a payment for all unpaid invoices

Error Handling: Broad 4xx/5xx/5xx+ coverage including malformed searchKey, server errors, dependency failures, timeouts (TC09, TC15, TC16, TC25, TC17).
Security/Robustness: Injection attempt handling without leaking sensitive info (TC17).
Performance/Load: Large data and concurrency checks (TC19, TC20).
Produces: application/json is asserted for success (TC01).
gaps: Rate Limiting: No scenarios for throttling/429 when many requests are sent rapidly.
Caching Behavior: No validation of ETag/Last-Modified, Cache-Control, or conditional requests (If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since).
Default Parameters: No explicit verification that defaults apply when omitted (offset=0, limit=100, audit=NONE) and resulting behavior (especially audit=NONE implying no audit info).
Response Schema: No validation against the Bundle schema (#/definitions/Bundle), including required fields, types, and audit substructures for FULL vs MINIMAL vs NONE.
Error Response Contract: No checks for error payload structure/content type (e.g., application/json with code/message), nor consistent status mapping per error type (e.g., 422 vs 400).
Authorization Depth: No scenario for authenticated but unauthorized user (403) if applicable to RBAC/tenant constraints.

Input Robustness: Missing tests for non-integer types for offset/limit (e.g., strings, floats), extremely large values beyond system caps, and handling of URL-encoded/Unicode searchKey, leading/trailing spaces, or case sensitivity.
Content Negotiation: No tests for Accept headers (e.g., requesting unsupported media types leading to 406) or ensuring correct Content-Type for errors.
Pagination Metadata: If the API surfaces pagination headers or total counts, there are no assertions; defaults and boundary transitions (e.g., last page) are only partially exercised.
Produces for Errors: Content type for error responses not validated.
recommendations: Add rate limiting tests: burst 50–100 rapid requests; expect 429 with Retry-After and verify unaffected steady-state behavior.
Add caching tests: verify ETag/Last-Modified and Cache-Control on 200; send conditional GETs (If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since) to assert 304 behavior.
Add default parameter scenarios: omit all query params and assert offset=0, limit=100 behavior and audit=NONE results (i.e., absence of audit fields).
Introduce schema validation: validate response objects against #/definitions/Bundle for required fields/types; verify audit shapes for FULL vs MINIMAL vs NONE.
Standardize error contract checks: assert error JSON schema (code, message, details) and specific status codes for invalid inputs (400) vs semantic issues (422) and server faults (5xx).
Extend authorization coverage: include 403 for authenticated but unauthorized users/tenants if the API enforces RBAC or tenant isolation.

Harden input validation: tests for non-integer offset/limit (e.g., offset=abc), float values, extremely large values beyond limits, URL-encoded and Unicode searchKey, trimming/whitespace, and case sensitivity rules.
Add content negotiation tests: Accept=application/xml (expect 406) and verify error responses return application/json with proper charset.
Validate any pagination metadata/headers if provided (e.g., X-KillBill-Pagination-Current/Max/Next), and add scenarios around last-page boundaries.
Assert Content-Type for error responses and consistent produces/consumes across all paths.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/bundles - Retrieve a bundle by external key

covered_items: GET Valid Request: Happy path with 200 and application/json verified (TC01), including array response with expected bundle and required fields (TC30).
Empty Response/Not Found: 404 when no matching bundle or empty system (TC08, TC16).

Query Parameters: Comprehensive coverage of valid and invalid combinations — includedDeleted true/false (TC02, TC06), audit FULL/MINIMAL/NONE (TC03–TC05), missing/empty required externalKey (TC07, TC29), unsupported params ignored (TC15), type/enum validation errors (TC09, TC10), edge cases like unicode, max/min length, unexpected formats (TC23–TC26).
Authorization: Unauthorized and forbidden access properly handled (401/403) (TC11, TC12).
Error Handling/Resilience: Service/db downtime and transient failures covered (503, retry) (TC13, TC21, TC28).
Concurrency/Performance: Concurrent requests and response time threshold (TC17, TC18).
Multiple results: Array with duplicates when data anomaly occurs (TC14).
Security hardening: SQL injection/XSS attempts handled without leakage (TC19, TC20).
Produces header/Content-Type: application/json asserted (TC01).
gaps: Caching Behavior: No checks for ETag/If-None-Match, Last-Modified/If-Modified-Since, or Cache-Control/Expires headers and 304 handling.
Rate Limiting/Throttling: No scenarios asserting behavior under request bursts or 429 Too Many Requests.
Default Parameter Behavior: No test that omitting includedDeleted defaults to false for a deleted bundle (expect 404), and no test that omitting audit defaults to NONE (no audit fields).
Pagination: Not addressed; if the endpoint cannot paginate by design for a single-key lookup, this should be explicitly documented as N/A. If supported, no tests exist for page/limit/next links.
recommendations: Add caching scenarios: verify ETag and Cache-Control presence on 200, then re-request with If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since to assert 304 Not Modified, and ensure no body on 304.
Add rate limiting tests: send a high volume of requests in a short window to validate 429 responses, retry-after headers, and that normal traffic remains unaffected.
Test default parameters: (a) deleted bundle with includedDeleted omitted should return 404; (b) audit omitted should behave as audit=NONE (no audit fields).
Clarify pagination applicability in the story or API docs. If supported, add tests for limit/offset (or cursors) and boundary conditions; if not, mark pagination as not applicable.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/invoicePayments/{paymentId}/customFields - Modify custom fields to payment

covered_items: PUT - Valid Request: Multiple success paths with 204 and database verification (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC17).
PUT - Non-Existing Resource: 404 when payment not found (TC06).
PUT - Concurrency Issues: Concurrent updates with consistency and performance assertions (TC19).
Error Handling - Invalid Path Parameter: 400 for invalid UUID format (TC05).
Error Handling - Malformed/Missing Body: 400 for missing body and malformed JSON (TC08, TC09).
Validation - CustomField schema invalid cases: 400 for invalid/missing fields (TC10).
Headers - Required/Optional: Enforces required X-Killbill-CreatedBy; handles optional Reason/Comment (TC01, TC02, TC07).
Security/Authorization: 401 for missing/invalid auth token (TC11).
Operational Resilience: 500 for backend/database failure (TC12).

Robustness/Edge Cases: Empty array behavior (TC04), large arrays/large payload (TC14, TC20), max value length (TC15), extra unexpected properties (TC16), duplicate field names regression (TC18), injection attempt handling (TC13).
Post-update Verification: Subsequent GET reflects updates (TC17).
gaps: PUT - Partial Update semantics: No explicit test that updating a subset of fields is rejected or supported; behavior (replace vs merge) is not validated.
Idempotency of PUT: No test to verify repeated identical PUTs do not change state or produce differing outcomes.
Content-Type enforcement: No scenario for missing or incorrect Content-Type (e.g., application/json) leading to 415/400.
Success response body/headers: No assertion that 204 returns no body and appropriate headers (e.g., absence of Content-Type).
Authorization granularity: 403 Forbidden vs 401 Unauthorized not differentiated; role/permission checks not covered.
CustomField schema specifics: No explicit tests for required properties and allowed name/value formats, enums, or objectType validation per schema.
Internationalization: No tests for Unicode/UTF-8 characters in names/values.
Empty array semantics: TC04 leaves behavior ambiguous (remove vs no-op) and does not assert definitive outcome per API contract.
recommendations: Add explicit partial update tests: send a payload with only one of several existing fields and assert whether the API replaces the entire set or merges; add a negative test if partial updates are not allowed.
Add idempotency test: repeat the same PUT request multiple times and assert stable 204 and unchanged state; include E2E verification via GET.
Add Content-Type validation scenarios: missing Content-Type and incorrect Content-Type (e.g., text/plain) should yield 415 Unsupported Media Type or 400, as per API behavior.
Assert 204 semantics: verify empty response body and appropriate headers (e.g., no Content-Type for 204).
Expand authorization tests: include a 403 Forbidden case for authenticated user lacking permissions if applicable.
Detail CustomField schema validation: tests for required keys, allowed key/value lengths, allowed characters, objectType/entityId correctness, and rejection of unknown enum values.
Add i18n tests: include Unicode characters and right-to-left scripts in field names/values.
Clarify and lock down empty array behavior: add separate scenarios for remove-all vs no-op based on API spec and assert the exact expected state via GET after PUT.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/invoicePayments/{paymentId}/customFields - Retrieve payment custom fields

recommendations: Add a scenario to confirm pagination behavior: for a payment with many custom fields, verify absence/presence of pagination headers (Link, X-Total-Count) and that all items are returned as per spec.
Add a 403 Forbidden scenario for an authenticated user lacking required permissions/tenant, ensuring correct status and error body.

Add caching tests: capture ETag/Last-Modified on first 200, re-issue request with If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since to validate 304 and header consistency; verify Cache-Control directives.
