Validate standardized error response structure for 400/401/404/502/503 (fields like errorType, code, message, requestId, timestamp).

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: DELETE /1.0/kb/catalog - Delete all versions for a per tenant catalog

covered_items: DELETE - Valid Deletion: Successful deletion returns 204 and removes all catalog versions (TC01, TC02, TC05, TC08, TC10, TC12, TC15).
DELETE - Non-Existent Resource: Proper handling for non-existent tenant (404) and tenant with no versions (still 204) (TC05, TC06).
DELETE - Concurrency: Concurrent requests handled; only one effective delete, others receive 204/404 as appropriate (TC13).
Error Handling: Missing required header (400/401), invalid/expired token (401), malformed headers (400), system failure (500) (TC03, TC04, TC07, TC09).
Security/Validation Hardening: Injection/malicious header values rejected (400/422) (TC11).
Optional Headers Behavior: Reason/Comment optional and accepted when present (TC02).
Side-effects Verification: Post-delete GET shows empty/404; ensures data actually removed and no orphaned references (TC01, TC12).
Non-standard input: Request body on DELETE is ignored while still succeeding (TC15).
Performance: Large number of versions still deleted within acceptable time (TC10).
gaps: DELETE - Soft Deletes: No explicit verification of soft-delete vs hard-delete behavior (e.g., flags, retrievability via admin/audit endpoints).
Authorization/Permissions granularity: No scenario for authenticated but unauthorized user (403 Forbidden) distinct from invalid token (401).
Idempotency: No explicit sequential test that a second DELETE after successful deletion returns a consistent/defined status (e.g., 204 or 404) and remains side-effect-free.
Tenant Isolation: No test ensuring deletion for one tenant does not impact catalogs of other tenants.
Audit Trail Persistence: No verification that X-Killbill-CreatedBy/Reason/Comment are recorded in audit logs/history for the delete operation.
Rate/Abuse Controls: No scenario covering burst DELETE attempts beyond concurrency (e.g., throttling/429) if applicable to the API policy.
recommendations: Add a soft-delete verification scenario (or explicitly assert hard-delete) by attempting to retrieve deleted versions via any admin/list endpoints or checking deletion flags and ensuring permanent removal is intended.
Add a 403 Forbidden scenario where the user is authenticated but lacks permission to delete catalogs for the tenant.
Add an idempotency scenario: perform DELETE twice sequentially and assert the defined behavior (e.g., first 204, second 404 or 204) with no side effects.
Add a tenant isolation scenario: seed two tenants; delete for tenant A; verify tenant B catalog versions remain intact.
Add an audit trail scenario: after DELETE with CreatedBy/Reason/Comment, query audit logs/history to confirm these values are persisted.
If applicable, add throttling/abuse scenario for rapid repeated DELETEs to validate 429 or documented behavior.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/bundles/{bundleId}/customFields - Add custom fields to bundle

covered_items: POST - Valid Payload: Happy paths with required and optional headers returning HTTP 201 and JSON array response (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC19).
POST - Invalid Payload: Malformed JSON, empty body, invalid schema, unsupported fields, duplicate field names, and empty array handled with HTTP 400 (TC08, TC09, TC10, TC12, TC11, TC18).
Path Parameter Validation: Invalid UUID format returns HTTP 400; non-existent bundle returns HTTP 404 (TC05, TC06).
Authorization: Missing/invalid auth returns HTTP 401 (TC14).
Large Payloads: Handles large but within-limit arrays; checks latency (TC17).
Operational/Dependency Errors: Service unavailable/dependency failure return HTTP 503 (TC15, TC20).
Resilience/Network: Timeout behavior acknowledged and retry policy noted (TC16).
Behavior with existing vs. no existing custom fields on bundle covered (TC03, TC04).
Acceptance criteria on response body shape (array of CustomField) verified on success (multiple TCs).
Extra query params tolerated without breaking success (TC13).
Security hardening scenarios (SQLi/XSS) considered (TC23, TC24).
gaps: POST - Duplicate Submission: No scenario for submitting the exact same payload twice (idempotency/duplication handling and expected status like 409/200/201).
Server Error Handling (500): No simulation of unexpected internal errors (e.g., DB failure) returning HTTP 500 per guidelines.
Response Headers: No checks that Content-Type is application/json on success and errors; no verification of other relevant headers (e.g., X-Killbill headers echoed, caching disabled).
Boundary Limits Exceeded: No scenario for payload exceeding system limits (e.g., very large array -> 413 Payload Too Large or 400 with clear message).
Partial Validation Behavior: No test for mixed-valid/mixed-invalid items in the same array to confirm all-or-nothing vs partial success contract.

Schema Fidelity: No explicit verification against the CustomField schema properties (types, allowed enums/lengths) beyond “missing required fields” (e.g., invalid data types, max length, forbidden characters).
Audit/Traceability: No checks that CreatedBy/Reason/Comment are persisted/audited as expected in created records.
Content Negotiation: No scenario for incorrect or missing Content-Type/Accept headers (e.g., text/plain body -> 415, missing Accept -> defaulting behavior).
Idempotency under Retry: Timeout test mentions client retry policy but does not assert server-side idempotency or duplicate prevention after retry.
recommendations: Add a duplicate submission scenario: send the same payload twice and assert expected behavior (e.g., second call returns 200 with existing fields, 201 with dedup, or 409 conflict) and data remains consistent.
Add a simulated internal server error (e.g., database failure) returning HTTP 500 and ensure error body does not leak internals.
Verify response headers: assert Content-Type: application/json on 201/4xx/5xx; ensure no caching headers if applicable (Cache-Control: no-store) for POST responses.
Add boundary overflow test: payload exceeding documented limits should return a clear error (e.g., 413 or 400) and no partial creation occurs.
Introduce mixed-validity test: one invalid CustomField among valid ones—assert transactionality (all-or-nothing) per spec and precise error messaging.
Broaden schema validation: add tests for invalid data types, max length violations, enum/range checks, prohibited characters, and whitespace-only values.
Audit assertions: after success, retrieve created fields to verify CreatedBy/Reason/Comment are stored/audited correctly.
Content negotiation: test unsupported media type (e.g., Content-Type: text/plain) -> 415; missing/incorrect Accept header behavior.
Expand timeout/retry test to verify server-side idempotency key or deduplication strategy if supported, ensuring no duplicate fields after client retries.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/catalog/product - Retrieve product for a given subscription and date

covered_items: Valid Request: Happy-path with subscriptionId and requestedDate (status 200, JSON Product schema, content-type) is covered (TC01).
Valid Request with parameter variants: Only subscriptionId (current product) covered (TC02) and backward compatibility (TC19).
Query Parameters: Broad coverage of valid/invalid combinations and unexpected params (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC06, TC08, TC14, TC16, TC17).
Empty/Not Found Responses: Non-existent subscription, before-start date, empty DB handled via 404s (TC05, TC11, TC13).
Error Handling (4xx/5xx): Invalid formats, unauthorized, service down, downstream failure covered (TC06, TC08, TC09, TC10, TC21).
Boundary/Edge Dates: Boundary change date and future/past dates addressed (TC12, TC13, TC18).
Schema and Data Consistency: Product object validation and match with catalog definition (TC01, TC22).
Performance/Load: Concurrent requests and response time under load covered (TC15, TC20).
gaps: Ambiguous behavior for omitted parameters: TC03 and TC04 allow multiple outcomes instead of asserting the contract; the story hints at default or error but tests should pin down exact behavior.
Caching Behavior: No scenarios validating ETag/If-None-Match, Last-Modified/If-Modified-Since, Cache-Control, or 304 Not Modified responses.
Rate Limiting/Throttling: No tests for 429 responses or retry headers under burst traffic. Load tests exist but do not validate rate-limit semantics.
Content Negotiation/Headers: No checks for Accept header handling, or that responses always include the required Content-Type and charset beyond TC01.
Time semantics: No explicit tests for timezone handling, date boundary at midnight, or invalid but well-formed dates (e.g., 2023-02-30), which can affect requestedDate parsing.
Authorization depth: 401 is covered, but no scenario for 403 (authenticated but not authorized) if RBAC/tenant scoping applies.
Idempotency/Determinism under concurrency: Load tests check performance, but not that repeated identical requests yield identical responses and no state leakage.
recommendations: Replace ambiguous outcomes in TC03 and TC04 with concrete expectations based on the API contract. For example: if subscriptionId is required, assert 400 with a clear error when missing; if requestedDate defaults to now, assert 200 with current product.

Add caching scenarios: (a) GET returns ETag/Last-Modified and appropriate Cache-Control; (b) conditional GET with If-None-Match returns 304; (c) changed product across dates invalidates cache as expected.
Add rate limiting scenarios: burst N requests within window -> observe 429 Too Many Requests and validate Retry-After headers; ensure normal throughput does not trigger limits.
Extend header/content negotiation tests: verify Content-Type includes charset; test Accept: application/json and unacceptable Accept to confirm 406 or documented behavior.

Add timezone and date parsing robustness: requestedDate with explicit timezone (UTC vs tenant TZ), boundary at 00:00:00, leap day (2024-02-29), and invalid calendar date (e.g., 2023-02-30) returning 400.
Include a 403 authorization scenario if the API enforces tenant/role permissions distinct from authentication.
Strengthen schema validation: validate full Product schema fields, required vs optional properties, and reject unknown fields in responses if contract demands.
Clarify TC12 (future date) to a single expected outcome per business rules (either the scheduled future product or 404/not-yet-effective) and assert it.
Add determinism checks under concurrency: same request repeated concurrently returns identical payloads and headers; no partial failures or inconsistent states.
Document non-applicability of pagination for this singular-resource endpoint to avoid misplaced expectations in future tests.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/catalog/xml - Upload the full catalog as XML

covered_items: POST - Valid Payload: Multiple success paths with well-formed XML, required and optional headers, and persistence verification (201, Location header may be present).
POST - Invalid Payload: Malformed/partial XML, empty body, whitespace-only XML return 400 with error messaging.
Headers Validation: Required X-Killbill-CreatedBy present/missing/empty; optional Reason/Comment covered; extra headers tolerated.
Authorization: Unauthorized/forbidden cases covered (401/403).
Duplicate Submission: Duplicate catalog version scenario covered with 201 or 409 expectation.
Large Payloads: Very large but well-formed XML scenario covered (201 or 400).
Validation: Boundary values in XML, special chars/unicode, comments/CDATA, encodings (UTF-8/UTF-16), minimal valid XML.
Operational/Resilience: Backend unavailable returns 503; network interruption scenario ensures no creation.
Performance: Normal and concurrent load scenarios with timing expectations.
Regression/Compatibility: Known-bug payload and older client compatibility tested.
gaps: POST - Server Error Handling: No explicit 500 Internal Server Error scenario (e.g., DB write failure) with expected body/headers.
Content Negotiation/Types: Wrong Content-Type ideally should yield 415 Unsupported Media Type; tests expect 400. No tests asserting response Content-Type (text/plain or application/json).
Rate Limiting/Throttling: No scenarios verifying HTTP 429 or graceful handling of burst traffic beyond limits.
Idempotency/Retry Safety: No tests ensuring repeated submissions after network timeouts do not create duplicate versions (idempotency keys or server-side dedupe if applicable).
Concurrent Conflict Handling: No explicit race test asserting deterministic handling (e.g., 409) when two identical versions upload simultaneously.
Header Value Constraints: No tests for CreatedBy/Reason/Comment max length, invalid characters, unicode normalization, or trimming behavior.
Payload Size Limits: No explicit boundary tests for maximum allowed size with expected 413 Payload Too Large and retry-after guidance if applicable.
Security Hardening: Malicious XML tested, but no assertions that external entity resolution is disabled (no outbound calls) and no sensitive info leakage in error responses.
Response Semantics: Limited verification of Location header variability (it is optional per story); no test for absence case. No verification of response body schema when JSON is returned.
recommendations: Add a scenario simulating an internal server error (e.g., DB failure) expecting 500 with standardized error payload.

Adjust and extend content-type tests: expect 415 for non-text/xml Content-Type; add tests asserting response Content-Type for success (text/plain or application/json) and honoring Accept header if supported.
Introduce rate limiting scenarios (burst beyond threshold) to verify 429 or documented behavior.
Add idempotency/retry scenarios: repeat the same upload after client timeout/network interruption and assert single catalog version creation (use idempotency key if supported).
Create a concurrent same-version upload test to ensure deterministic outcome (201 once, 409 for the loser, or documented behavior).
Add header value validation tests: overly long CreatedBy/Reason/Comment, invalid chars, unicode, leading/trailing whitespace handling.
Define explicit payload size boundary tests, including 413 Payload Too Large and clear error messaging; verify no partial creation.
Enhance security tests: verify XXE/external entity resolution is disabled (no outbound DNS/HTTP), assert generic error messages without stack traces.
Expand response validation: test cases where Location header is absent (allowed), and validate response body structure when JSON is returned (e.g., contains URI field or message).

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/allCustomFields - Retrieve account customFields

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/bundles/{bundleId}/resume - Resume a bundle

covered_items: PUT > Valid Request: Multiple positive paths verify 204 response and functional effects (bundle and all paused subscriptions resume).
PUT > Non-Existing Resource: 404 when bundle not found (empty DB/random UUID).
PUT > Concurrency Issues: Concurrent resume requests verified with first 204 and subsequent 400/409.
Parameter Validation: bundleId UUID format (400), requestedDate valid future date, past date rejected (400), pluginProperty valid array and large list handling.
Headers: Required X-Killbill-CreatedBy enforced (400 if missing); optional X-Killbill-Reason and X-Killbill-Comment handled and audited; boundary lengths covered.
Authorization: Unauthorized/invalid user results in 401/403.
Robustness/Resilience: Dependency failure 500, plugin service latency/timeout 504, retry after transient failure succeeds.
Security: SQL injection attempt in pluginProperty and XSS in comment handled safely.
Idempotency/Invalid State: Already active/cancelled bundles rejected with 400.
Extra Inputs: Unexpected query params are ignored/do not break success.
gaps: PUT > Partial Update: Not applicable here (no request body), but no scenario asserts that sending an unexpected body is rejected or ignored consistently.
requestedDate format validation: No tests for invalid date formats, timezone handling (e.g., Z, offsets), or boundary like today/now semantics.
pluginProperty collectionFormat=multi: No test using repeated query keys (pluginProperty=...&pluginProperty=...) and mixed valid/invalid entries.
Response headers/content negotiation: No assertions on Content-Type/produces=application/json, nor behavior when Accept header is non-JSON for a 204 response.
Auditing breadth: Only verifies reason/comment recorded; no check that CreatedBy is captured in audit logs.
Rate limiting/throttling: No scenarios validating behavior under API-level rate limits.
Idempotency on repeat same request after success: Covered via concurrency partially, but not a clean sequential retry of the same request resulting in 204 vs 400/409 per contract.
Error body schema: Tests assert presence of an error message but not structure/schema (code, message, type) for 400/404/401/403/500/504.
recommendations: Add a scenario sending a non-empty JSON body to the PUT and assert the API either rejects with 400 or ignores it per spec (document expected behavior).
Extend requestedDate tests: invalid format (e.g., 2025-13-01, 2025-02-30), timezone forms (UTC Z and +/- offsets), and boundary like today to confirm server rules.
Add pluginProperty tests using collectionFormat=multi (multiple repeated query params), empty array, duplicate keys, and mixed valid/invalid entries to confirm strict/lenient parsing.
Assert response headers: verify Content-Type on error responses and that 204 has no body; include Accept header variations to confirm content negotiation behavior.
Audit log assertions: verify CreatedBy, Reason, and Comment are all recorded with correct values and timestamps.
Include a rate-limiting scenario (burst of requests) to confirm proper 429 or acceptable handling if rate limits apply to this endpoint.
Add a sequential idempotency test: resume paused bundle (204), immediately repeat same request and assert defined outcome (400/409) without side effects.
Validate error response schema across 400/401/403/404/500/504 to ensure consistent fields (e.g., error type/code/message).

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/accounts/payments - Trigger a payment using the account external key

covered_items: POST - Valid Payload: Multiple successful creation scenarios using default and explicit payment methods, optional headers, and plugin parameters (TC01–TC06).
POST - Invalid Payload: Malformed body, missing required fields/headers, invalid UUID format, and unsupported parameters are exercised (TC08–TC11, TC19).

Story Error Mapping: All specified error codes are covered with clear triggers: 400 (missing/malformed), 402 (declined), 404 (account not found), 422 (control plugin abort), 502 (gateway submission failure), 503 (unknown status), 504 (timeout) (TC08–TC16).
Authorization: Unauthorized access (401) is validated (TC17).

Headers/Response: Required header X-Killbill-CreatedBy validated; Location header and JSON Payment response asserted on success (multiple).
Optional Query Params: paymentMethodId, controlPluginName, and pluginProperty tested in various combinations, including only-one-present cases (TC02–TC06).
Security: Malicious payload/XSS-style input is handled without execution and with logging (TC18).
Resilience/Dependencies: Gateway down mapped to 502/503 (TC24).
Regression/Compatibility: Specific pluginProperty regression and backward compatibility scenarios (TC25–TC26).
Performance: Response time under normal/peak load and resource utilization under stress (TC27–TC29).
gaps: POST - Duplicate Submission/Idempotency: No scenario validates behavior when the same request is submitted twice (e.g., retry semantics, duplicate protection).
POST - Server Error Handling (500): No explicit simulation of internal server/database failure returning 500.
Validation Depth: No explicit tests for invalid business values (e.g., negative/zero amount disallowed, invalid currency codes, unsupported transactionType enum, precision/scale constraints).
Content Negotiation/Headers: No checks for response Content-Type=application/json; no test for 415 Unsupported Media Type when Content-Type is incorrect or missing.

Query Array Encoding: controlPluginName/pluginProperty specify collectionFormat=multi; tests use comma-separated lists, but no scenario verifies multiple query parameters encoded as repeated keys (?controlPluginName=a&controlPluginName=b).
Missing Body: Request body is required; no scenario for completely missing body (as opposed to malformed) to assert 400.
Ownership/Association Validation: No test for paymentMethodId that is well-formed but not associated with the specified account.
Forbidden (403): No scenario for authenticated but unauthorized action (RBAC/permission denied) if applicable.
Rate Limiting/Abuse Controls: High-frequency POSTs not validated for throttling/429 (if enforced).
recommendations: Add an idempotency/duplicate submission test: submit the same PaymentTransaction twice (same idempotency key if supported) and verify the second response (e.g., 201 with same resource or 409/422 depending on API contract).
Introduce a 500 Internal Server Error simulation (e.g., DB outage) and assert proper error body and observability (logs/metrics).
Expand validation tests: negative and zero amounts, over-precision amounts, invalid/unsupported currency, invalid transactionType values, out-of-range pluginProperty values.
Add content negotiation checks: verify response Content-Type=application/json; add a case posting with incorrect Content-Type (text/plain) to assert 415.
Verify collectionFormat=multi by sending repeated query parameters for controlPluginName and pluginProperty instead of comma-separated lists, and assert both parsing and behavior.
Add a test for missing request body (empty payload) to assert 400 with descriptive error.
Validate paymentMethodId ownership: use a valid UUID belonging to a different account and assert correct error (400/404 based on service contract).
Consider a 403 Forbidden scenario to distinguish authenticated-without-permission vs. unauthenticated (401), if RBAC applies to this endpoint.
If applicable, add rate limiting/throttling scenarios to validate 429 or defined behavior under burst POST traffic.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: DELETE /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/emails/{email} - Delete email from account

DELETE Concurrency: Concurrent deletes covered; one 204 and remaining 404.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: DELETE /1.0/kb/admin/healthcheck - Put the host out of rotation

gaps: Response headers: Story states Produces: application/json, but tests do not assert Content-Type or header behavior for 204 (and 204 typically has no body/Content-Type).

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: DELETE /1.0/kb/bundles/{bundleId}/customFields - Remove custom fields from bundle

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/credits/{creditId} - Retrieve a credit by id

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/block - Block an account

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/auditLogsWithHistory - Retrieve account audit logs with history by account id

recommendations: Add pagination scenarios: verify default page size, ability to request multiple pages (e.g., limit/offset if applicable), or explicitly assert that the endpoint is unpaginated for large datasets; include headers/links if implemented.
Add caching tests: validate Cache-Control and ETag headers on 200, perform conditional GET with If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since to expect 304, and ensure body omission on 304.
Introduce rate limiting tests: burst multiple requests to trigger 429, assert Retry-After and X-RateLimit-* headers, and that normal throughput is unaffected outside limits.
Expand authorization: include a 403 scenario for authenticated user lacking scope/tenant or permission to access the account.
Assert content negotiation: check Content-Type: application/json; add a scenario with unsupported Accept to expect 406 or documented behavior.
Cover multi-value blockingStateTypes: send repeated blockingStateTypes (e.g., ACCOUNT and SUBSCRIPTION) with repeated blockingStateSvcs and validate intersection/union per spec.
Validate error schema: for 400/401/503/504, assert standardized error fields and codes to ensure consistent client handling.
Add header verifications: include correlation/request ID presence and stability across logs; optionally validate gzip/transfer encoding where relevant.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/emails/{accountEmailId}/auditLogsWithHistory - Retrieve account email audit logs with history by id

gaps: Pagination: No scenarios validating pagination behavior for large datasets (or explicitly asserting that pagination is not supported).

Add 403 authorization tests: authenticated user lacking permissions should receive 403.
Use real UUIDs for valid cases and add format boundary tests (uppercase UUIDs, missing hyphens, wrong lengths) to verify strict pattern enforcement.
Add association integrity test: accountEmailId belonging to a different accountId should return 404.
Validate standardized error schema and headers: check error code, type, message fields, Content-Type=application/json for 4xx/5xx.
Simulate a 500 Internal Server Error (e.g., DB outage) and verify response status and observability headers/log correlation IDs if applicable.
Expand header checks: verify Content-Type and charset on all responses; test Accept negotiation (e.g., requesting text/plain returns 406 or falls back appropriately).

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: DELETE /1.0/kb/invoiceItems/{invoiceItemId}/tags - Remove tags from invoice item

covered_items: DELETE/Valid Deletion: Successful removal with and without tagDef; idempotent behavior when no tags exist (204).
DELETE/Non-Existent Resource: 404 for unknown invoice item ID.
Input validation (story-specific): 400 for invalid invoiceItemId (non-UUID), malformed tagDef, empty/partial tagDef; handling of tag IDs not present on the item.
Headers: Required X-Killbill-CreatedBy present; optional X-Killbill-Reason and X-Killbill-Comment exercised (including special characters).
Authorization: 401 for invalid/expired token.
Operational errors: 503 when service unavailable; dependency outage scenario considered.
Security hardening: Injection/XSS attempts in headers validated.
Concurrency: High-concurrency DELETE requests scenario included.
Query params: Extra/unexpected parameters tolerated; tagDef presence/absence and large lists covered.
gaps: Soft delete vs hard delete behavior not asserted (guideline: Soft Deletes).
Concurrency edge cases on the same resource not asserted (e.g., simultaneous deletes on the same invoice item verifying deterministic final state and consistent per-request responses).

Multi-value query encoding not explicitly verified (collectionFormat=multi, e.g., repeated tagDef parameters and URL encoding).

recommendations: Add a scenario to verify soft-delete semantics (or explicitly confirm hard delete) and expected audit trail behavior.

Validate error response contract: assert Content-Type application/json, error code fields, messages, and schema; also verify 204 responses have no body and no misleading Content-Type.
Add tests for collectionFormat=multi encoding: repeated tagDef parameters (tagDef=uuid1&tagDef=uuid2), URL-encoded values, and mixed valid/invalid entries.
Include authorization/permissions tests: missing auth token (401) and authenticated without permission (403).
Define and test explicit limits for tagDef cardinality and URL length; add a clear 413 scenario when limits are exceeded.
Add assertions for observability/audit logging on success (e.g., entries with CreatedBy/Reason/Comment) and behavior when audit logging is async or partially failing.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: DELETE /1.0/kb/admin/cache/tenants - Invalidates Caches per tenant level

covered_items: DELETE Valid Deletion: Happy path returns 204 with empty body and cache invalidated (TC01, TC09, TC13).
Idempotency: Repeated deletion or empty cache still yields 204 with no adverse effects (TC09).
Non-Existent Resource: Tenant context not found returns 404 (TC04).
Authorization: Unauthenticated and invalid credentials return 401 (TC02, TC03).
Error Handling: 400 for malformed requests (TC07), 500 for internal error (TC05), 503 for service unavailable (TC06), 504 for timeout (TC14).
Security/Hardening: Injection attempt in headers leads to safe 400/403 and descriptive error (TC08).
Concurrency: Multiple concurrent DELETEs for same tenant return 204 with no race conditions (TC10).
Behavioral Effects: Subsequent requests and dependent services reflect invalidation (TC01, TC12).
Regression Guardrail: Ensures previously fixed bug doesn’t recur (TC11).
Empty Response Semantics: Verifies response body is empty on 204 (TC01, TC09).
gaps: Authorization (Forbidden): No scenario for authenticated but not authorized user (e.g., non-admin) expecting 403.
Rate Limiting/Throttling: No scenario asserting 429 or graceful handling when exceeding request limits.
Tenant Context Missing/Invalid Format: No test for missing tenant headers/context format errors (e.g., 400 or 412 when tenant header not provided).
Content Negotiation/Headers: No verification of response headers (Content-Type/Produces application/json claim on 204), nor handling of Accept headers.
Unsupported Media Type: No scenario for requests with an inappropriate Content-Type or body on DELETE returning 415.
Multi-tenant Isolation: No test proving invalidation impacts only the current tenant and not other tenants.
DELETE Method Semantics Beyond Same-tenant Concurrency: No scenario for concurrent deletes across different tenants to ensure isolation under load.
Observability: No checks for standard error structure (error codes, correlation IDs) or retry-after header on 503/429 (if supported).
Soft Deletes: Guideline mentions soft deletes; while likely N/A for caches, there is no explicit assertion that data is immediately purged vs. flagged.
recommendations: Add a 403 Forbidden scenario for authenticated but unauthorized roles attempting DELETE.
Introduce rate-limiting tests to verify 429 responses and proper headers (e.g., Retry-After) when limits are exceeded.
Add tests for missing or malformed tenant context headers/tokens and expected status (400/412), plus validation error payload.
Verify response headers across cases: absence of Content-Type on 204 or expected header values, and Accept negotiation behavior.
Add a 415 Unsupported Media Type scenario for DELETE requests carrying a body with Content-Type set.
Create multi-tenant isolation scenarios: ensure deleting cache for Tenant A does not affect Tenant B, including under concurrent load.
Extend concurrency coverage to include parallel deletes for multiple tenants and interleaved read operations to ensure no cross-tenant bleed-through.
If applicable, standardize error response schema validation (fields like code, message, requestId) and headers for troubleshooting.
Clarify and, if applicable, assert that cache invalidation is a hard delete (not soft) to align with DELETE guidelines.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/accounts/{childAccountId}/transferCredit - Move a given child credit to the parent level

covered_items: PUT - Valid Request: Happy path returning 204 is covered, including balance movement verification (TC01) and with optional headers/audit logging (TC02).
PUT - Non-Existing Resource: 404s for missing child and parent accounts are covered (TC04, TC05, TC12).
PUT - Concurrency Issues: Concurrent requests from the same child are handled; only one succeeds and others fail due to insufficient credit (TC14).
Validation Errors: No credit on child -> 400 covered (TC03); malformed UUID -> 400 (TC07); missing required header -> 400 (TC06); malicious/unexpected header values -> 400/422 (TC11, TC15).
Authorization/Security: Unauthorized/forbidden access -> 401/403 covered (TC10).
Operational Resilience: API unavailable -> 503 covered (TC09).
Performance: Large dataset performance baseline with response time expectation is covered (TC13).
Regression Guardrail: Double-transfer attempt validates proper rejection on second call (TC16).
Header Handling: Optional headers accepted and recorded; extra headers ignored (TC02, TC08).
gaps: Server Error Handling: No scenario for unexpected internal failures (e.g., 500 Internal Server Error during transfer processing) and corresponding rollback/consistency.
Content Negotiation and Response Headers: No checks for Accept/Content-Type alignment with produces application/json; for 204, no assertion that response body is empty and headers are correct.
Idempotency/Retry-Safety: No scenario validating behavior on retrying the same request (e.g., via an Idempotency-Key) to prevent duplicate transfers after network timeouts.
State Integrity After Failures: No explicit assertions that balances remain unchanged after 400/404/5xx outcomes.
Business Rule Clarification: Amount semantics are implicit; since there is no request body, tests should assert full available credit moves (child -> zero, parent +exact amount).
Relationship Validation: No scenario where the child has a parent set but not actually linked/authorized to that parent (mismatched hierarchy) resulting in a 400.
Error Contract: No verification of error payload schema/fields (code, message, type) for 400/404/401/403/503 to ensure consistent API error responses.
Backward Compatibility: TC17 does not define how previous API versioning is negotiated or a negative case when unsupported; lacks concrete acceptance headers (e.g., version) and expected outcomes.
Rate Limiting/Throttling: No tests for burst traffic behavior or proper 429 handling (cross-cutting non-functional).
recommendations: Add a 500 Internal Server Error simulation (e.g., database failure during transfer) and verify no partial transfer occurred and consistent error payload.
Augment success tests to assert 204 has no body and appropriate headers; add Accept/Content-Type checks aligned with produces application/json.
Introduce idempotent retry scenarios using an Idempotency-Key (if supported); verify a retried request does not double-transfer and returns an idempotent response.
For each failure path (400, 404, 503, 401/403), assert that child and parent balances are unchanged to guarantee atomicity.
Clarify and test transfer amount semantics: with no request body, assert that the entire available child credit is moved (child balance becomes zero) and parent increases by that exact amount.
Add a scenario where the child’s recorded parentId does not match the target hierarchy or parent is not allowed to receive credit from the child, expecting 400 with a clear error.
Validate a standard error schema across all error responses (fields like errorCode, message, status, requestId) and locale if applicable.
Make backward compatibility concrete: specify the versioning mechanism (header or URL), add both positive (supported) and negative (unsupported) cases with expected status codes.
Consider adding a rate limiting test to observe 429 Too Many Requests behavior and Retry-After header if the platform enforces throttling.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/export/{accountId} - Export account data

covered_items: GET • Valid Request: Successful 200 with application/octet-stream and valid archive (TC01, TC02, TC14).
GET • Required/Optional Headers: Required X-Killbill-CreatedBy enforced; optional Reason/Comment accepted (TC01–TC03).
GET • Invalid Path Parameter: 400 for malformed UUID and injection attempts (TC04, TC11).

GET • Resilience/Errors: 500 when service unavailable and 504 on timeout (TC10, TC17).
GET • Performance/Scale: Large export and slow downstream behavior validated with acceptable response constraints (TC08, TC09).
GET • Concurrency: Multiple concurrent requests return 200 with valid archives (TC13).
Protocol correctness: 405 for unsupported HTTP method (TC16).
Robustness: Extra/legacy headers tolerated without breaking success (TC06, TC15).
gaps: GET • Caching Behavior: No checks for ETag/Last-Modified or Cache-Control headers on the export response.
GET • Rate Limiting/Throttling: No scenario asserting behavior under burst traffic (e.g., 429 Too Many Requests or appropriate headers).
GET • Error Schema Consistency: No validation that 400/404/500/504 responses follow a documented error contract (code, message, requestId, etc.).
GET • Content-Disposition/filename: No verification that response includes Content-Disposition with a sensible filename for download.
GET • Empty Response Semantics: No scenario for account that exists but has minimal/no data to confirm archive structure (non-empty stream vs explicit handling).

Observability: No checks for correlation/request ID headers in responses (if part of API standards).
Documentation Accessibility (TC19) is outside API runtime behavior; no automated check that error messages are accessible/standardized in responses.
recommendations: Add caching scenarios: assert absence or presence of Cache-Control (e.g., no-store) and ETag/Last-Modified as per API standards for binary exports.
Add rate limiting tests: send high-rate bursts, expect either 200 within limits or 429 with Retry-After and proper headers; ensure concurrency tests also observe rate limiting policy.
Validate error response schema: assert JSON error body fields (e.g., errorCode, message, type, requestId) for 400/404/500/504, and content type (application/json).
Verify Content-Disposition: assert header is present with attachment; filename includes accountId and extension (.zip/.tar.gz as applicable). Also consider Content-Length presence/accuracy.
Add minimal-data export case: seed account with no invoices/subscriptions and assert archive is valid, contains required scaffolding, and is not an empty stream.

Extend security/observability checks: assert response includes correlation IDs (e.g., X-Request-Id) and that CreatedBy/Reason/Comment are accepted but not echoed in response; optionally verify server-side audit logs in integration tests.
Clarify N/A items: Pagination and query parameters do not apply to this endpoint; document as intentionally not covered to avoid confusion.
Tighten performance expectations: replace vague thresholds with concrete SLOs (e.g., P95 < 5s for 100MB export) and verify streaming does not exhaust memory.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: DELETE /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId} - Close account

covered_items: DELETE > Valid Deletion: Multiple success paths with 204, including default behavior and all query-parameter combinations (TC01–TC07, TC19–TC20).
DELETE > Non-Existent Resource: Explicitly covered with idempotent 204 for non-existent and already-closed accounts (TC11, TC12).
DELETE > Soft Deletes: Verifies the account is marked as closed (soft delete) and not hard-deleted (TC01, TC06).
DELETE > Query Parameters/Validation: Exhaustive coverage of defaults and combinations, including each flag alone and pairs; invalid format for accountId returns 400 (TC02–TC05, TC08).
Headers: Required header X-Killbill-CreatedBy enforced (400 on missing) and optional headers handled; backward compatibility with only required headers (TC09, TC20).
Authorization: Missing or invalid auth returns 401 (TC10).
Server error handling: Simulated 500 on DB outage (TC14).
Security: SQL injection in path rejected (400); XSS attempt in header handled safely (TC15–TC16).
Performance/Scalability: Large dataset processing and concurrent closures receive 204 and timing expectations (TC07, TC18).
Idempotency: Repeated/duplicate closure yields 204 with no further changes; retry on transient failure remains safe (TC11, TC17).
Robustness: Extra/unsupported query parameters are ignored without failure (TC13).
gaps: DELETE > Concurrency (race conditions on same resource): No scenario where two clients concurrently delete the SAME account and validate idempotent 204s, absence of conflicts, and consistent side effects.
DELETE > Concurrency with dependent resources: No test where subscription/invoice actions race with account closure (e.g., cancellation in progress) to ensure consistent final state.
Input validation for query parameters: No negative tests for invalid boolean values (e.g., cancelAllSubscriptions=abc), duplicated params, or mixed-case booleans.
Response contracts on 204: No assertions that the 204 response has an empty body and appropriate headers (e.g., Content-Type absent or consistent with API contract).
Authorization/Permissions depth: No 403 scenario for authenticated user lacking permission/role to close accounts.
Auditability: No verification that CreatedBy/Reason/Comment are recorded in audit logs or system history (if expected by platform conventions).
Error payload consistency: While errors are asserted, there is no validation of error schema/fields (code, message, type) or content type for 400/401/500 responses.
Soft delete propagation: No checks that closed account is no longer actionable by other endpoints (e.g., creating new subscriptions) post-closure.
recommendations: Add a concurrency test deleting the same account from two clients at once and confirm both return 204, with consistent, single-set side effects and no conflicts.
Introduce a scenario where dependent operations race (e.g., subscription cancellation running concurrently) to verify consistent final state and absence of partial failures.

Add negative query-parameter validation: invalid boolean values, repeated parameters, mixed-case values, and unexpected numeric/string for boolean flags should yield 400 or be explicitly ignored per spec.
Assert 204 has no response body and verify headers per contract (e.g., no Content-Type or a specific header policy for 204 responses).
Add a 403 Forbidden test for an authenticated user lacking the permission to close accounts.
Verify audit trail persistence of X-Killbill-CreatedBy/Reason/Comment where applicable (e.g., fetch audit logs) to ensure traceability.
Validate error response schema and content type for 400/401/500 (fields like code, message, reason, requestId), and ensure consistency across failures.
Post-closure behavior: Add tests ensuring closed accounts cannot perform new actions (e.g., create subscription), confirming soft-delete is enforced across the system.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/catalog/phase - Retrieve phase for a given subscription and date

covered_items: Valid Request: Successful retrieval with both parameters (TC01) validates 200 and JSON Phase object.
Empty Response/No Data: Non-existent subscription (TC05), out-of-range date (TC08), and empty database (TC12) verify appropriate 404 handling.

Query Parameters: Broad coverage of combinations and validation, including missing params (TC03, TC04), extra params ignored (TC14), invalid UUID/date formats (TC06, TC07), and boundary date correctness (TC15).
Authorization: Unauthorized access returns 401 (TC09).
Content Negotiation/Headers: Content-Type application/json verified (TC01).
Robustness/Security: SQL injection attempt sanitized with safe error (TC11).
Resilience/Errors: Service unavailable scenario covered with 503 (TC10).
Performance: Large dataset response time (TC13) and concurrent requests correctness/latency (TC16).
gaps: Caching Behavior: No scenarios validating caching headers (ETag, Last-Modified, Cache-Control) or conditional requests (If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since).

Response Schema Validation: Only a generic check for a “valid Phase object.” No schema-level assertions for required fields and types per definitions/Phase.

Clarify and split TC02: create two explicit scenarios based on product decision: (a) returns default phase with 200 when requestedDate omitted, or (b) returns client error (e.g., 400) when business rules require requestedDate. Remove ambiguous “or” expectations.
Add schema validation: assert the Phase object matches the contract (required fields, data types, enums) and no extra unexpected fields are present.
Document pagination as Not Applicable for this endpoint to align with guidelines and avoid future false gaps.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/customFields/search - Search custom fields by type, name and optional value

Error Handling/Dependencies: Service unavailability and degraded dependencies covered (TC18, TC33).

Introduce rate limiting tests: rapid burst of requests to trigger 429 with Retry-After; verify headers and backoff behavior.

Add deterministic ordering checks: define and assert a stable sort key (e.g., createdDate, id) and verify consistent ordering across pages.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/admin/invoices - Trigger an invoice generation for all parked accounts

Observability/Audit verification: TC03/TC16 state operation should be auditable but don’t verify that audit logs/history actually contain CreatedBy/Reason/Comment with correct values and timestamps.
Content negotiation: No test for Accept header handling or 406/415 behaviors (if the API enforces them), even though body is N/A.
recommendations: Add a 500 Internal Server Error scenario by simulating a backend/database failure, asserting proper status code and sanitized error payload.
Introduce rate-limiting/throttling tests to verify behavior under bursts (expect 429 or defined degradation policy).
Add an authorization test where a valid non-admin user attempts the call and receives 403 Forbidden.
Extend pagination tests: offset beyond last index should yield 200 with zero processed; add a limit-above-maximum case to assert 400 with clear validation message.
Add a scenario asserting that only parked accounts are processed and non-parked accounts remain unchanged (data integrity check).
Verify deterministic paging: two sequential calls with non-overlapping pages should not overlap; include a test ensuring stable sort key and consistent results.
Validate response body schema: assert presence and correctness of fields like processedCount, offset, limit, errors, and any operation/job identifier if defined.
Tighten status code expectations: make TC05 expect 400 for missing required header; define exact behavior for unexpected parameters in TC11 (either 400 or ignore with 200) per spec.
Enhance audit checks: retrieve and assert audit log entries capturing X-Killbill-CreatedBy, Reason, and Comment for the operation.
Optionally add content negotiation tests: specify Accept: application/json and verify 406/415 handling if unsupported media types or Accept headers are provided.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/cbaRebalancing - Rebalance account CBA

covered_items: PUT > Valid Request: Multiple happy-path scenarios validate 204 responses and successful CBA rebalancing (TC01–TC07).
PUT > Non-Existing Resource: Invalid/non-existent accountId returns proper client error (TC08, TC09, TC16, TC17).
PUT > Concurrency Issues: High-concurrency behavior covered; verifies consistent end state (TC18).
Header handling: Required CreatedBy header present/validated; optional Reason/Comment accepted (TC01–TC03, TC02).
Header validation (negative): Missing/empty/whitespace/null CreatedBy produce errors (TC10, TC11, TC25, TC26).
Robustness/negative: Unsupported HTTP method 405 (TC22), unexpected query params tolerated (TC23), extra headers ignored (TC12).
Resilience: Transient network retry and service unavailability behavior considered (TC13, TC14).
Security hardening: SQLi in CreatedBy and XSS in Comment covered; no leakage/reflection (TC15, TC24).
Performance: Basic latency SLAs under normal and peak load (TC20, TC21).
gaps: PUT > Partial Update: Not applicable for this endpoint (no request body). Consider explicitly asserting that a body is ignored/rejected to prevent misuse.
Authorization: No negative tests for missing/invalid auth token leading to 401/403 despite Background assuming valid auth.
Idempotency: No explicit test that repeated calls yield the same final CBA and consistent 204 response when no changes are needed.
Outcome verification depth: Steps say "CBA should be rebalanced" but do not assert observable state via a GET or audit log; lacks concrete post-conditions (e.g., exact balance, events generated).
Audit headers effect: No checks that CreatedBy/Reason/Comment are persisted to audit logs/history as Kill Bill typically supports.
Error contract: 400 error body format/schema not asserted (e.g., standard Kill Bill error code/message structure); also no check that 204 responses have no body and correct Content-Type headers.
Rate limiting/throttling: No scenarios for 429 or backoff behavior under burst traffic.
Internationalization/encoding: No tests for unicode or long values in headers (e.g., non-ASCII CreatedBy/Comment) or max length constraints.
Observability: No checks for correlation/request IDs or server-side logging headers if applicable.
Security headers: No validation of security-related response headers (e.g., no-cache on 204, or absence of reflective data).
recommendations: Add explicit authorization negatives: missing token, expired token, insufficient permissions -> expect 401/403.
Add idempotency tests: invoke rebalancing twice; verify second call returns 204 and CBA remains unchanged.
Strengthen post-condition checks: after PUT, perform GETs (e.g., account balance/transactions) or query audit logs to assert exact expected CBA and that rebalancing considered all transactions.
Validate audit trail: confirm CreatedBy, Reason, and Comment are recorded in audit/history for the rebalancing operation.
Define and assert the error schema for 400 responses (fields like error, message, code), and verify 204 has no response body and appropriate headers (Content-Type absence or correctness).
Add negative auth/rate limiting tests including 429 under burst conditions if enforced by the API gateway.
Extend input validation: test unicode and max-length boundaries for headers; ensure proper rejection/sanitization.
Optionally add a test ensuring request bodies are not accepted for this PUT (e.g., sending a payload yields 400/415) to prevent misuse.
Document and assert any observability headers (e.g., X-Request-Id) if standard in your API platform.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/bundles/{bundleId}/auditLogsWithHistory - Retrieve bundle audit logs with history by id

Empty Response: Existing bundle with no audit logs returns 200 with empty array (TC02).

Service Unavailable: 503 scenario covered (TC07).
Query Parameters: Unexpected query parameter tolerated without breaking behavior (TC08).

Large Dataset/Performance: Very large number of audit logs handled within thresholds (TC10).
Reliability/Retry: Transient network failure and successful retry (TC12).

Cross-endpoint Consistency: Data consistent with other related audit log endpoints (TC14).
Concurrency/Load: 50 concurrent GETs succeed without degradation (TC17).
URL Variants: Trailing slash handled (TC18).
HTTP Method Safety: Non-GET results in 405 (TC21).
gaps: Pagination: No tests verify pagination behavior or explicit absence thereof for large datasets.
Caching Behavior: No checks for ETag/If-None-Match, Last-Modified/If-Modified-Since, or Cache-Control headers.
Rate Limiting/Throttling: No scenarios for 429 or header-based rate limit feedback under burst traffic.
Authorization Depth: No coverage of 403 (authenticated but not authorized) if applicable to this endpoint.
Content Negotiation: No tests for Accept headers variations (e.g., application/json, */*) or charset handling.
Server Error Handling: No scenario for 500 Internal Server Error behavior.
Required Path Parameter Omission: No test for missing bundleId segment or malformed path leading to 400/404.
Schema Versioning/Contract: While schema conformity is asserted, no explicit negative tests for unexpected fields or strict schema validation failures.
Response Headers: No validation of standard headers (Date, Content-Type charset, X-Request-Id/correlation if standard in platform).
recommendations: Add pagination-related tests: verify presence/absence of pagination parameters, behavior on large datasets, and confirm contract if pagination is not supported.
Introduce caching tests: assert ETag/Last-Modified in 200 responses and 304 behavior with conditional GETs, plus Cache-Control directives as per API policy.
Add rate limiting scenarios: burst requests to elicit 429 (if enforced) and validate Retry-After and related headers.
Expand auth coverage: add a 403 scenario for an authenticated user lacking required permissions/roles if the API enforces authorization.
Test content negotiation: include Accept header variations and verify correct Content-Type and fallback behavior.
Include a 500 Internal Server Error simulation (e.g., DB failure) to verify graceful error payloads and no stack traces.
Add path robustness: request without bundleId or with double slashes to confirm 400/404 and clear error messaging.
Tighten schema tests: add negative cases with intentionally malformed responses via mocks/contract tests to enforce strict schema adherence.
Validate key response headers consistently, including charset in Content-Type and any standard correlation/request ID headers used by Kill Bill.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/bundles/{bundleId}/pause - Pause a bundle

covered_items: PUT > Valid Request: Multiple happy paths returning 204, with and without optional query params and headers (TC01–TC05).
PUT > Non-Existing Resource: 404 for non-existent bundleId (TC07, TC20).
PUT > Concurrency Issues: Concurrent pause requests handled so only one succeeds; others fail appropriately (TC21).
Input Validation: Invalid UUID format (TC06), past and malformed requestedDate (TC17–TC18), invalid pluginProperty format (TC19), extra unexpected query params ignored (TC15).
Headers: Required X-Killbill-CreatedBy present and missing-case handled (TC01, TC10); optional reason/comment captured (TC04).
Authorization: Unauthorized user returns 401 (TC11).
State Validation: Already paused and canceled bundles return 400 (TC08–TC09).
Large/Boundary Inputs: Very large pluginProperty array handled (204 or 413) (TC16).
Resilience/Dependencies: Upstream service unavailable (503) (TC12); dependent plugin down (502) (TC25).
Security Negatives: SQL injection in path (TC13) and XSS in headers (TC14).
Side-effects: All active subscriptions within the bundle paused; scheduling respected (TC01–TC02).
Regression/Isolation: Pausing one bundle does not affect others (TC23).
Internationalization: Special characters in pluginProperty processed (TC24).
Performance/Load: Basic throughput expectation under load (TC22).
gaps: PUT > Partial Update: Not applicable is fine, but no explicit scenario asserting that a request body is ignored/rejected (since the API is body-less).
Headers/Response Metadata: No checks for Content-Type or absence of body with 204; spec says produces application/json but 204 typically has no body—this should be asserted.
requestedDate Edge Cases: No timezone handling tests (UTC vs local), end-of-day boundaries, or requestedDate equal to current date/time semantics (immediate vs scheduled).

pluginProperty Encoding: No scenario verifying multi collection format via repeated query keys (pluginProperty=...&pluginProperty=...), URL encoding of keys/values, or duplicate property keys handling.
Rate Limiting/Throttling: No tests for 429 or backoff behavior under burst traffic; load test (TC22) doesn’t validate rate limiting semantics.
Auditing Verification Depth: TC04 asserts audit logging generically but doesn’t retrieve and verify audit records via audit API for exact values (createdBy, reason, comment, timestamp).

Idempotency/Repeatability: While already-paused returns 400, no test verifies that repeating the exact same valid request immediately before pause takes effect (e.g., same requestedDate in future) behaves deterministically (e.g., 204 once, 400 on duplicates) with consistent audit entries.
Error Model Consistency: Tests assert presence of generic error messages but don’t verify standardized error schema (code, message, context) and correlation/request-id headers.
Server Error Handling: No explicit 500 Internal Server Error path (e.g., DB failure) distinct from 502/503.
Observability/Events: TC26 asserts downstream reflection but lacks concrete verification steps (event bus message, webhook, or downstream API read-back).
recommendations: Add a scenario asserting 204 responses include no body and validate Content-Type/Content-Length headers for correctness on 204.
Extend requestedDate coverage: same-day current timestamp, timezone variants (UTC vs tenant TZ), DST boundaries, and exact boundary behavior when requestedDate == now.
Add pluginProperty encoding tests: repeated query parameters (collectionFormat=multi), URL-encoded values, duplicate keys, and empty values; assert server behavior.
Introduce rate limiting scenarios: burst traffic leading to 429 with Retry-After; ensure graceful degradation separate from concurrency correctness.
Enhance auditing checks: after pause, query audit logs to assert createdBy, reason, comment, changeType, and timestamps match expectations.
Add idempotency-like behavior tests for future scheduled pauses: submitting the identical request twice should not create duplicate schedules; verify single event and consistent response codes.
Verify standardized error response schema for 400/401/404/413/500/502/503 including error codes and correlation IDs.
Simulate and assert 500 Internal Server Error (e.g., DB outage) distinct from 502 plugin dependency and 503 service unavailable.
Make TC26 concrete: validate downstream consistency via specific artifacts (e.g., event/message presence, downstream API state) with eventual consistency window if applicable.
Optionally add a negative test asserting that any unexpected request body is rejected with 400/415 to make the body-less contract explicit.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/customFields/search/{searchKey} - Search custom fields

covered_items: Valid Request: Multiple happy paths validate successful searches with and without query parameters (e.g., TC01, TC02, TC03–TC05, TC22, TC27–TC29).
Empty Response: Covered via no matches and offset beyond range returning empty arrays (TC06, TC09).
Pagination: Verified paging behavior across pages, offsets, small and large limits, and combined with audit (TC02, TC08, TC09, TC28).

Query Parameters: Broad coverage of valid and invalid values for limit/offset/audit, unsupported params ignored, defaults explicitly set, edge inputs for searchKey (TC03–TC05, TC10–TC14, TC21, TC25–TC27, TC29).
Authorization: Missing and invalid tokens return 401 (TC15, TC16).
Error Scenarios: Backend unavailable (503) and parameter validation errors (400) covered (TC11–TC14, TC17).
Method Enforcement: Unsupported HTTP method returns 405 (TC30).
Security/Robustness: Special characters/XSS and Unicode in searchKey handled safely (TC18, TC27).
Performance/Concurrency: Baseline stress and concurrent request behavior validated (TC19, TC20).
gaps: Rate Limiting: No scenarios verifying throttling behavior or 429 responses under burst traffic.
Caching Behavior: No checks for ETag/Last-Modified, Cache-Control headers, or conditional requests (If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since).

Defaults When Omitted: No explicit assertion that omitting limit/offset/audit yields defaults (limit=100, offset=0, audit=NONE) in responses; TC01 does not verify absence of audit fields, and TC29 sets defaults explicitly rather than omitting.
Response Headers: No verification of Content-Type=application/json or charset, nor Accept handling.
Schema Validation: No strict validation of CustomField object structure and audit fields against the API schema; only high-level assertions are made.
Server Error 5xx Breadth: Only 503 covered; no 500 internal error simulation (e.g., DB failure) to verify generic error handling contract.
Boundary Values: No test for limit=0, extremely large offset within int64 range, or maximum server-enforced limit if different from client-provided 1000.
Internationalization/Encoding: While Unicode searchKey is tested, no verification of correct response encoding headers or normalization handling.
Pagination Consistency: No assertions about stable ordering or non-overlapping/duplicate items across pages.
recommendations: Add rate limiting tests: simulate rapid bursts to trigger 429, assert Retry-After, and verify graceful degradation.
Add caching tests: assert ETag/Last-Modified and Cache-Control on 200 responses; perform conditional GETs expecting 304 when appropriate.
Add tests that omit query params to confirm defaults: GET without limit/offset/audit should return limit=100 items max, start at offset=0, and exclude audit info. Validate absence of audit fields.
Verify response headers: assert Content-Type=application/json; optionally test Accept negotiation.
Introduce schema validation: validate CustomField objects against the API definition, including audit fields for FULL/MINIMAL/NONE.
Add 500 error path: simulate internal server error (e.g., DB exception) and assert standard error envelope and 500 status.
Extend boundary tests: cover limit=0 (expect 400), very large offset near int64 max (valid vs. overflow), and enforce/document server-side max limit if 1000 is not allowed.
Validate encoding/i18n: assert response uses UTF-8 and properly returns/escapes Unicode; check no mojibake and proper headers.
Add pagination consistency checks: verify deterministic ordering and that page 1 and page 2 have no overlaps or gaps given fixed dataset and sort.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/credits - Create a credit

covered_items: POST/Valid Payload: Single and multiple credit creation with required fields (TC01, TC02).
POST/Valid Payload: Adjusting a specific invoice via invoiceId (TC03).
POST/Valid Payload: No invoiceId creates a credit/CBA as appropriate (TC07, TC26).
POST/Query Parameters: autoCommit behavior verified when true (TC04).
POST/Query Parameters: pluginProperty passed and integration observed (TC05).
Headers: Required X-Killbill-CreatedBy present; optional Reason/Comment supported (TC01, TC06).
Response: 201 Created, response body as JSON array of InvoiceItem, Location header checked (TC01, TC02, TC03).

Error Handling 400: Missing required header, malformed JSON, missing fields, invalid accountId format, unsupported currency, invalid pluginProperty, empty body (TC10, TC11, TC12, TC14, TC15, TC16, TC21).
Error Handling 404: Account not found, invoice not found (TC08, TC09).
Validation: Positive amount handling explored (TC13).
Duplicate Submission: Retry should not create duplicates (idempotency) (TC30).
Large Payloads and Limits: Max allowed, very large payload leading to 413/400, timeout handling (TC23, TC24, TC25).
Integration Failures: Plugin unavailable (503) and plugin error (400/500) (TC28, TC29).
System Unavailable: API down returns 503 (TC17).
Security Hardening: SQL injection and XSS payload handling (TC19, TC20).
State/Business Effects: New credit invoice when none exists; balance updated with existing credits/invoices (TC26, TC27).
Non-functional: Performance under normal and peak load; resource utilization under stress (TC32, TC33, TC34).
gaps: Server Error Handling: No explicit scenario simulating internal DB/storage failure returning 500 (distinct from plugin errors).
Content Negotiation: No checks for request Content-Type=application/json and response Content-Type=application/json; no behavior when incorrect Content-Type or missing Accept header.
autoCommit default semantics: No scenario verifying that omitting autoCommit leaves invoice uncommitted and requires manual commit.
Array semantics: No scenario for an empty JSON array ([]) body; expected 400 vs no-op is unspecified and untested.
Mixed validity in batch: No test where the array contains both valid and invalid items to confirm all-or-nothing vs partial success behavior and error reporting.
Cross-account items: No scenario with multiple InvoiceItems across different accountIds to confirm policy (allowed vs rejected with 400/409).
Amount validation boundaries: No tests for zero amount, excessively large magnitude, currency precision/scale rounding, or min/max constraints.
itemType validation: No negative test for unsupported itemType values and ensuring CREDIT_ADJ/CBA_ADJ are enforced/derived correctly.
Location header optionality: Tests assert Location header presence, while story says it may be present; no scenario allowing it to be absent without failing the test.
Response headers: No verification of Produces application/json beyond body shape; no checks for other standard headers (e.g., Location for multiple resources, correlation/request-id if applicable).
Authorization breadth: 401 unauthenticated (no/invalid auth token) not explicitly covered beyond missing CreatedBy; permission model beyond 403 not detailed.
recommendations: Add a scenario to simulate an internal server error (e.g., DB failure) returning 500 to complete POST server error handling coverage.
Add content negotiation tests: reject requests without Content-Type=application/json (415) or with wrong media type; verify response Content-Type=application/json.
Add a test for default autoCommit=false verifying the invoice remains uncommitted when the query param is omitted, and that a manual commit (via subsequent operation) is required.
Add a scenario sending an empty JSON array ([]) and assert the expected behavior (preferably 400 with a clear validation message).
Add a mixed-validity batch scenario to confirm transactional behavior (all-or-nothing vs partial success) and validate error structure per item if partial is supported.
Add a cross-account batch scenario (InvoiceItems with different accountIds) to confirm whether it is allowed; if not, assert appropriate 400/409.
Extend amount validation: zero value, extremely large amounts, precision/scale per currency, and rounding behavior; include clear expected codes (400).
Add negative tests for invalid itemType and a positive test asserting correct derivation/enforcement of itemType (CREDIT_ADJ vs CBA_ADJ) based on presence of invoiceId.
Relax Location header assertions or add a scenario that accepts its optional nature to match the story (“may point to created resources”).
Verify response headers: ensure Produces application/json is honored; if multiple resources are created, define and test Location header behavior (single vs none vs collection URI).
Add an explicit 401 unauthorized scenario (e.g., missing/invalid auth token) if applicable to the API gateway/security layer to round out auth coverage.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/bundles/{bundleId}/tags - Add tags to bundle

covered_items: POST Valid Payload: Multiple success scenarios (single, multiple, empty array) returning 201 with JSON array of Tag objects and persistence checks (TC01, TC03-07).
POST Invalid Payload: Malformed JSON, non-array body, invalid/missing body, extra fields, invalid tag UUIDs all return 400 with meaningful errors (TC10-12, TC14-15, TC18).
Validation: Path param UUID format for bundleId (TC08), non-existent bundleId handled (TC09), required X-Killbill-CreatedBy header enforced; optional headers covered (TC02, TC13).
Large Payloads: Max-allowed and exceeding payload tests present (TC20-21).
Server Error Handling: Service/database unavailable (503) and timeout (504) considered (TC17, TC22); transient network failure with retry success (TC19).
Authorization: Unauthorized/missing token returns 401 (TC16).
Response Contract: Confirms application/json array of Tag objects, correct IDs, and integration verification via GET (TC27).
Non-functional: Performance under normal and peak load (TC24-25).
Regression: Duplicate tags in request or pre-existing tags do not create duplicates and reflect current state (TC06, TC26).
Headers: Extra unsupported headers are tolerated without breaking success path (TC23).
gaps: POST Server Error Handling: No explicit test for generic 500 Internal Server Error with appropriate error schema.
Authorization/Permissions: No test for insufficient permissions/forbidden action (expected 403) when user lacks rights.
Duplicate Submission/Idempotency: No scenario to verify behavior when the same request is retried without changes (e.g., safe replays vs. duplicate creation).
Content-Type Validation: No test for missing or incorrect Content-Type header (e.g., text/plain) resulting in 415 Unsupported Media Type or 400.
Accept Header/Negotiation: No test for unsupported Accept header leading to 406 Not Acceptable (if applicable).
Semantic Validation: No test for sending duplicate tag UUIDs within the same payload and ensuring only unique tags are created and response reflects deduplication.

Error Code Alignment: Story specifies 400 for invalid bundleId or malformed body; behavior for non-existent bundleId could reasonably be 404. Current tests assume 400; alignment with API contract should be clarified and tested.
recommendations: Add a scenario to simulate an unexpected server exception and assert a 500 response with the standard error format.
Add a scenario for insufficient permissions (missing scope/role) returning 403 Forbidden.
Introduce an idempotent retry test: resend the exact same POST with the same request-id or payload and confirm no duplicate creation and stable response.
Add tests for missing and incorrect Content-Type header to validate 415/400 handling.
Add a scenario for unsupported Accept header to validate 406 behavior if the API enforces content negotiation.
Add a scenario where the request body contains duplicate tag definition UUIDs to ensure deduplication or defined behavior.
Clarify and align expected status for non-existent bundleId (400 vs 404) and add/update scenarios accordingly.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/tags - Add tags to account

covered_items: POST/Valid Payload: Successful creation with single and multiple tags (TC01, TC02), with/without pre-existing tags (TC04, TC05), and with optional headers (TC03).

POST/Invalid Payload & Validation: Empty body (TC07), non-array body (TC08), malformed tag UUID (TC09), non-existent tag def (TC10), missing required header X-Killbill-CreatedBy (TC11), missing/invalid accountId (TC12, TC13), invalid extra element types in array (TC17), special characters in IDs (TC23).
Duplicate Submission Handling: Duplicate tag IDs in one request de-duplicated (TC19) and concurrent requests avoid duplicates (TC21).
Large Payloads: Boundary case with 100 tag IDs (TC18).
Authorization: Unauthorized (missing/invalid auth token) returns 401 (TC15).
Server Error Handling: Dependency/service unavailable returns 503 (TC16).
Non-functional: Performance latency threshold (TC20).
URL Query Handling: Extraneous pagination/sort params on POST are ignored (TC06).
Success Response Semantics: 201 status and JSON array of Tag objects; persistence verified (TC01–TC05, TC18, TC24).
gaps: Response headers: No verification of Content-Type: application/json in success/error responses; no check for Produces per story.
Content negotiation/media type: No tests for missing or incorrect Content-Type (e.g., 415) or unsupported Accept (e.g., 406).
Forbidden/permissions: No scenario for authenticated user lacking permission (403), despite Background mentioning permissions.

Partial validity: No scenario where body contains a mix of valid and invalid tag IDs to assert overall failure vs partial success behavior.
Idempotency/replay: No explicit test for repeating the exact same POST twice to ensure no duplicate tags and consistent status code.

recommendations: Add response header assertions: verify Content-Type: application/json on 201 and error responses; include Produces compliance.
Add media type tests: send request with missing/incorrect Content-Type (expect 415) and unsupported Accept (expect 406).
Add a 403 scenario for an authenticated user without the required permission to add tags.
Simulate and assert a 500 Internal Server Error path (e.g., database failure) in addition to 503.
Create a mixed-validity test: body contains both valid and invalid tag UUIDs; define and verify expected behavior (likely 400 with detailed error, no partial creation).
Add an idempotency/retry test: POST the same tag IDs twice; verify second call does not create duplicates and confirm expected status (201 or 200) per API contract.
Enhance schema checks: validate key Tag fields and types in the response payload against definitions (#/definitions/Tag).
Introduce rate limiting/throttling test if applicable to POST: rapid bursts should return appropriate status/headers.
Assert audit propagation: when X-Killbill-Reason/Comment are provided, verify they are stored/visible in audit logs or related metadata.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/catalog/availableAddons - Retrieve available add-ons for a given product

Include a 403 Forbidden test for authenticated users lacking permission to view catalog/add-ons (if the API enforces roles).

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: DELETE /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/tags - Remove tags from account

covered_items: DELETE Valid Deletion: Successful removal of one, many, all tags; 204 with empty body (TC01–TC05, TC13, TC19, TC20).
Non-Existent Resource: 400 for invalid/non-existent accountId and invalid accountId format (TC06, TC07).
Input Validation: Invalid/malformed tagDef values and mixed valid/invalid sets return 400 (TC08, TC14, TC18).
Required/Optional Headers: Required X-Killbill-CreatedBy enforced; optional X-Killbill-Reason and X-Killbill-Comment handled (TC04, TC09, TC19).
Business Rule: AUTO_PAY_OFF requires default payment method; enforced with 400 (TC10).
Empty/No-op Behavior: Deleting from accounts with no tags is a no-op with 204; empty tagDef array and no tagDef remove all tags (TC03, TC05, TC20).
Resilience/Errors: 5xx when service unavailable; retry after transient network failure succeeds (TC12, TC16).
Performance/Load: Concurrent DELETEs across multiple accounts complete within acceptable time (TC17).

gaps: Concurrency (same resource): No scenario for concurrent DELETEs against the same account/tags to detect race conditions or lost updates.
Idempotency: No explicit test that repeating the same DELETE (tags already removed) consistently returns 204/no-op.
Soft delete vs hard delete: No verification of audit/history behavior or that deletion is not a soft delete, per guideline.
Response headers: No checks for Content-Type on 204 responses, and no verification of error response schema/headers despite "produces: application/json" in story.
Account with no tags + no tagDef: Missing explicit scenario for removing all (no tagDef) when the account already has zero tags.

Validation of tagDef duplication: No case where duplicate tagDef IDs are sent to ensure de-duplication/no side effects.
Large input robustness: Large tagDef list boundary conditions (max count/size, URL length) are not asserted with expected server handling.
recommendations: Add a scenario for concurrent DELETEs on the same account/tag set (e.g., two clients removing the same tags simultaneously) and assert consistent outcomes and absence of 409/500 unless specified.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/paymentMethods/{paymentMethodId}/setDefault - Set the default payment method

PUT - Non-Existing Resource: 404s covered for missing account, missing payment method, payment method not belonging to account, and account without payment methods (TC08–TC10, TC21).

Validation: UUID format invalid/partial, extreme UUID values, and non-existent resources (TC06, TC07, TC16, TC23).
Headers: Required X-Killbill-CreatedBy present/absent; optional Reason/Comment audited (TC04, TC11).
Query Parameters: payAllUnpaidInvoices true/false/no invoices; pluginProperty multi-values/empty; unexpected extra param (TC02, TC05, TC03, TC24, TC14, TC15).

Reliability/Errors: Service unavailable and downstream timeout handling (503/504) (TC13, TC18).
Regression/Behavioral: Old default cleared when setting new default (TC20).
Performance: Large unpaid invoices processing and response time expectations (TC17).
gaps: PUT - Idempotency: No scenario for setting the same payment method as default again to ensure idempotent 204/no side effects.

Error Handling: No coverage for generic 500 Internal Server Error when backend fails unexpectedly.
Authorization: No 403 Forbidden scenario (authenticated but not authorized/insufficient permissions).

Plugin Properties Validation: Not testing special characters, URL-encoded values, duplicates, or invalid types in pluginProperty.

recommendations: Add an idempotency test: setting the already-default payment method returns 204 and makes no additional payment attempts.
Add a negative test with an unexpected JSON body or incorrect Content-Type to confirm it is rejected (400 or 415).
Introduce a 500 simulation (e.g., DB failure) to validate generic server error handling and error payload format.
Add a 403 test case for authenticated user lacking permission to modify the account.
Extend header validation: empty string, excessively long values, non-UTF8 characters, and newline injection in Reason/Comment.
Verify response headers for 204 (no body, appropriate Content-Type/absence thereof) and any required cache-control headers for non-cacheable responses.
Add a failure-path test for payAllUnpaidInvoices=true where some invoices fail to pay: verify status code, partial failure handling, and audit/logging behavior.
Add pluginProperty robustness tests: special characters, URL-encoding, duplicated keys, and invalid types to ensure proper parsing/validation.
Add rate limiting/throttling scenario to validate handling of high-frequency PUT requests (expect 429 or configured behavior).

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/children - List children accounts

recommendations: Add pagination scenarios: verify default page size, page/limit parameters (if supported), boundary values, and linkage (next/prev); for large datasets, assert page counts instead of fetching all.

Add ordering checks: specify and verify deterministic sort (e.g., by createdDate or accountId) to ensure reproducible results.
Verify produces contract: assert application/json per spec and absence of unexpected fields when defaults are used.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/bundles/{bundleId} - Transfer a bundle to another account

POST - Validation: Broad input validation on path/body/query/header params including UUID format for bundleId, requestedDate format, billingPolicy enum, required headers/body (TC08-TC12).

POST - Content Negotiation: No tests for incorrect Content-Type (e.g., text/plain) returning 415 or missing/incorrect Accept header returning 406.

Body Field Validation: No test for invalid accountId format (non-UUID) resulting in 400; only non-existent and injection are covered.
