Request Body Schema Strictness: No test for additional/unknown fields inside JSON body (TC19 covers extra request parameters generally, but not unknown fields within the Bundle object) and type errors for pluginProperty entries (non-string types).
Temporal Rules: No tests for requestedDate in the past/future edge cases if the API imposes constraints, or timezone handling/format nuances.
Response Headers: No checks for Content-Type application/json on success/error responses or other standard headers (no-cache, correlation IDs if applicable).
recommendations: Add an idempotency/duplicate submission suite: send the same request twice (with and without an Idempotency-Key if supported) and assert deterministic behavior (second call 200/201 with same result or 409 Conflict).

Assert default behaviors: a scenario that omits billingPolicy and verifies default END_OF_TERM is applied, and clarifies effective transfer date when requestedDate is omitted.
Extend body validation: negative test for invalid accountId format (non-UUID) and type validation errors inside body (e.g., accountId as number).
Include a 403 Forbidden scenario for authenticated users lacking permission to transfer bundles.
Introduce rate-limiting tests: burst POSTs to validate 429 responses and retry-after headers (if implemented).
Add functional concurrency tests for same-bundle race: two concurrent transfer requests for the same bundle—assert one succeeds and the other fails gracefully (e.g., 409).
Tighten schema strictness: send unknown fields inside the Bundle JSON and non-string values in pluginProperty to assert they are rejected or ignored per contract.
Add temporal edge cases: requestedDate in past and future, timezone variants, and boundary formats to ensure correct parsing and enforcement.
Verify response headers consistently: assert Content-Type application/json for 201/4xx/5xx and any standard headers required by API guidelines.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/customFields - Add custom fields to account

covered_items: POST - Valid Payload: Multiple success scenarios with 201 and correct JSON array response (TC01–TC05, TC13, TC14, TC29, TC30).

Authorization Depth: No test for 403 Forbidden (authenticated but not authorized).
Default Parameter Explicitness: No explicit test for audit=NONE query value (only implicit via omission).
Schema Validation: No rigorous validation of Tag object schema against definitions (only high-level assertions).
recommendations: Add scenarios to validate caching headers (ETag, Last-Modified, Cache-Control) on 200 responses and support for conditional requests returning 304 Not Modified.
Introduce rate limiting tests: send bursts until limit triggers and verify 429, Retry-After/RateLimit-* headers, and recovery after cooldown.
Add an authorization test for 403 Forbidden with a user lacking bundle access/permission.
Create a scenario for audit=NONE explicitly to confirm behavior matches the default.
Enhance response validation by asserting the Tag schema (required fields, types, audit fields presence per audit level) and Content-Type charset if applicable.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/catalog/plan - Retrieve plan for a given subscription and date

covered_items: GET Valid Request: Happy paths covered for both parameters provided (TC01), single parameter cases (TC02, TC03), none provided (TC04), boundary dates (TC13), and extra/ignored params (TC14).
Empty Response: Covered via empty database (TC11) and cases allowing empty object when no match (TC03, TC04).
Query Parameters: Wide combinations and validations covered, including malformed UUID/date (TC05, TC06), non-existent resource (TC07), both invalid (TC08), and extra params (TC14).
Authorization: Unauthorized (401) covered (TC09).
Error Handling (story-specific): Correct mapping for 400/404 and system/service errors (TC05–TC08, TC10), data integrity conflict (TC12).
Performance: Latency under normal and concurrent load covered (TC15, TC16).
Security/Validation Hardening: Injection and XSS input handling covered (TC17, TC18).
gaps: Caching Behavior: No scenarios check Cache-Control/ETag/Last-Modified headers or conditional requests (If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since).
Rate Limiting: No test for throttling/429 responses, Retry-After header, or behavior under burst traffic beyond latency checks.
Authorization (403): No coverage for authenticated user lacking required permissions (forbidden).
Content Negotiation and Media Type: No explicit assertions for Content-Type: application/json or Accept header handling; no test for 406 Not Acceptable.
Response Schema Validation: "valid JSON Plan object" is vague; no schema-level assertions against the Plan definition (required fields, types, enums).
Date Semantics and Timezone: No tests for out-of-range dates (before first plan or far-future), timezone/locale nuances, or date parsing strictness beyond format.
Default Behavior When Params Omitted: Story notes default or error when parameters are omitted; tests allow multiple outcomes but don’t pin expected behavior (could cause flaky expectations).
Observability/Correlation: No checks for standard error payload structure (code, message) or correlation/request IDs in errors, which can be part of API standards.
Idempotent Header Handling: No tests for ignoring duplicate query params or conflicting values (e.g., multiple requestedDate entries).
recommendations: Add caching scenarios: verify Cache-Control and ETag headers on 200; send If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since to assert 304 Not Modified behavior, and ensure body is omitted on 304.
Add rate limiting tests: burst requests to trigger 429 Too Many Requests and verify Retry-After header; confirm normal behavior resumes after backoff.
Add 403 forbidden scenario: authenticated user without sufficient permissions should get 403 with proper error body.
Assert media types: verify Content-Type: application/json on success and errors; add Accept header tests including an unsupported media type to validate 406.
Strengthen schema validation: validate the Plan object against the API schema (required fields, field types, enum values) and ensure no extra unexpected fields are present.

Expand date semantics: tests for requestedDate before any plan effective date (expect 404 or defined default), after last plan, and explicit timezone handling if server interprets dates in UTC; include leap day and DST boundary checks if applicable.

Clarify and codify behavior for omitted parameters: create explicit scenarios that assert the single expected outcome (default plan vs. error) for: only subscriptionId, only requestedDate, and neither provided.
Validate standard error payload contract: assert presence/format of error code, message, and correlation/request ID across 4xx/5xx responses.
Add a test for duplicated/conflicting query params to ensure the API either rejects with 400 or defines a deterministic precedence.

Optionally, add header checks for security hardening (e.g., no reflection in error bodies for XSS payloads) and verify that extra query parameters are ignored consistently across all outcomes, not only success.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/admin/healthcheck - Put the host back into rotation

covered_items: PUT Valid Request: Successful 204 with empty body and host state updated (TC01).
Idempotency: Re-PUT when already in rotation returns 204 and keeps state unchanged (TC02).
Authorization: 401 for unauthenticated/missing headers (TC03, TC09) and 403 for insufficient privileges (TC04).
Service Availability: 503 when service/endpoint is down (TC05).
Method Handling: 405 for wrong HTTP method (TC06).
Concurrency: Concurrent PUTs complete without race conditions (TC14).
Resilience/Retry: Transient network interruption followed by successful retry (TC13).
Performance: Response within acceptable timeout under load (TC10).
Security Hardening: Malicious header payload does not compromise system; returns 204 or appropriate error (TC12).
Header Robustness: Extra headers tolerated (TC08).
Empty/No Body Handling: Explicitly tests no request body path (TC01).
Regression Coverage: Previously fixed defect remains fixed (TC11).
gaps: Non-Existing Resource: No scenario for attempting to put a non-existent/unknown host back into rotation (expected 404 or domain-appropriate error).
Server Error Handling: No simulation of unexpected internal failures (e.g., DB/cluster error) returning 5xx, especially 500.
Content Negotiation/Produces: Story notes Produces: application/json, but tests do not assert response headers (e.g., Content-Type absent on 204, or correct Content-Type for error responses).

Partial Update Semantics: PUT guideline expects rejection of partial updates unless allowed. With a no-body API, TC07 sends a non-empty body and expects 204; behavior should be clarified or a 400/415 should be asserted.
Unsupported Media Type: No test for incorrect Content-Type (e.g., text/plain) when a body is sent, expecting 415 if the API enforces media types.
Non-Functional Rate/Throttling: No explicit test for 429 or throttling behavior under bursts; may be out of scope but useful for an admin endpoint.
recommendations: Add a scenario for non-existing/unknown host context (e.g., when the target host is not registered or decommissioned) returning 404 or a specific error code.
Add server error simulations (inject backend failure) to verify 500 handling and error payload shape.
Assert headers: for success 204 verify no body and optionally no Content-Type; for error responses verify Content-Type: application/json and error schema.

Clarify and align behavior for unexpected request bodies. If bodies are not allowed, add a scenario expecting 400 Bad Request (or 415 Unsupported Media Type) when a payload is provided; otherwise document that the endpoint ignores bodies and still returns 204.
Add a scenario for 415 Unsupported Media Type when Content-Type is invalid and a body is present.
Optionally add a throttling/rate-limiting scenario (429) if applicable to admin APIs, or explicitly document it as not enforced.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/invoiceItems/{invoiceItemId}/tags - Retrieve invoice item tags

Empty Response: Explicit scenario validates empty array when no tags exist.
Query Parameters: Comprehensive coverage of valid/invalid values (missing required accountId, invalid UUIDs, invalid boolean/enum, extra unexpected param).
Error Handling: 400 for invalid IDs/params, 404 for not found (item/account/empty DB/partial DB), 503 when backend unavailable; response messages asserted.
Security Hardening: SQL injection/XSS payloads do not leak info or execute.
Performance: Normal and peak load scenarios assert response time and stability.
Integration: Audit logging downstream integration present (operational and unavailable).
gaps: Pagination: No scenarios validating pagination for large tag sets (if endpoint supports it).
Caching Behavior: No checks for ETag/Last-Modified/Cache-Control headers on GET responses.
Rate Limiting/Throttling: No tests for 429 or graceful handling when exceeding request limits.
Authorization Depth: 401 is covered, but no 403/role-based access tests or scope checks.
Ownership Validation: No scenario where invoiceItemId exists but does not belong to provided accountId (should return appropriate 404/403 per design).
Default Parameter Behavior: No explicit verification that deleted tags are excluded when includedDeleted is omitted but deleted tags exist.
Audit=NONE: No explicit scenario asserting default NONE audit level fields are absent when audit is not provided.
Response Headers: No assertions on Content-Type=application/json; charset, or that Produces is honored via Accept negotiation.
Generic Server Errors: No coverage for unexpected 500 Internal Server Error behavior and error contract.
Test Relevance: UUID min/max length edge cases are not applicable for fixed-format UUIDs; consider removing or reframing.
recommendations: Add pagination scenarios: large tag set returning paged results; verify page size, next/prev links, and boundaries (if applicable).
Add caching checks: assert ETag/Last-Modified/Cache-Control on 200; add conditional GET with If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since expecting 304.
Add rate limiting tests: burst requests to trigger 429; verify Retry-After and that behavior recovers after window resets.
Expand authorization: add 403 scenarios (valid token without permission), and token with insufficient scope/tenant mismatch.
Add ownership mismatch scenario: invoice item belongs to a different accountId should return 404/403 per API contract.
Verify default param behavior: with mixed active/deleted tags and no includedDeleted, assert deleted tags are excluded.
Add explicit audit=NONE scenario: assert absence of audit fields and correct defaults when audit omitted.
Assert headers: Content-Type=application/json; charset, and Accept negotiation; ensure extra headers do not change behavior.
Include generic 500 error simulation: database failure or unexpected exception path with consistent error payload.
Remove or adjust UUID length edge cases: replace with tests that strictly enforce UUID pattern and case sensitivity if relevant.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/search/{searchKey} - Search accounts

covered_items: GET > Valid Request: Happy path with only required path param; responses include expected account arrays and optional fields when requested.
GET > Empty Response: Scenarios for no matches and empty database return 200 with empty arrays.
GET > Pagination: offset/limit individually and in combination, including large dataset pagination, are exercised.

GET > Query Parameters: Valid and invalid values for booleans, enums, and pagination are tested; combinations including both accountWithBalance and accountWithBalanceAndCBA are covered; unexpected extra params are handled.
GET > Authorization: Missing and invalid tokens return 401.
Non-functional: Performance and concurrency under load are considered (large data and concurrent requests).
Resilience: Timeout (504), service down (503), and dependency failures (502/503) are covered.
Security: Malicious inputs (SQLi/XSS) are validated and rejected.
gaps: GET > Rate Limiting: No scenarios verify throttling behavior or 429 responses when exceeding request limits.
GET > Caching Behavior: No checks for ETag/If-None-Match, Last-Modified/If-Modified-Since, Cache-Control, or 304 Not Modified.
GET > Authorization: No coverage for 403 Forbidden (authenticated but not authorized) cases.
GET > Response Headers: No verification of Content-Type (application/json), charset, or consistent produces contract.
Schema Validation: No explicit validation against the Account schema (fields, types, required/optional) beyond presence of balance/CBA/audit.
Input Encoding: No tests for URL-encoded searchKey with reserved characters to ensure correct decoding and routing.

Boundary Values: No tests for extreme but valid pagination bounds (e.g., very large limit within system cap) or documented defaults enforcement (limit default 100, offset default 0) beyond functional assertions.
Stability of Sorting/Determinism: Pagination assertions do not verify deterministic ordering across pages (important for offset/limit correctness).
recommendations: Add rate limiting tests: burst requests to trigger throttling and assert 429 with Retry-After; verify no degradation for allowed rates.
Add caching tests: first GET captures ETag/Last-Modified; subsequent conditional GET should return 304; verify Cache-Control directives per API policy.
Add 403 authorization scenario: authenticated user lacking scope/role receives 403 with appropriate error body.
Assert response headers: Content-Type application/json; charset if applicable; ensure produces contract holds across scenarios.
Introduce schema contract checks: validate response array items against the Account definition (required fields, data types), including presence/absence of balance/CBA/audit based on flags.
Test URL encoding: use percent-encoded special characters in searchKey to confirm server decodes properly and avoids false 400s.
Add boundary tests: verify maximum allowed limit and large offset behaviors; confirm defaults (offset=0, limit=100, audit=NONE) via explicit header/body assertions.
Verify deterministic ordering: define and assert a stable sort key (e.g., accountId or name) so pagination across pages is consistent.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/catalog/xml - Retrieve the full catalog as XML

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/block/{blockingId}/auditLogsWithHistory - Retrieve blocking state audit logs with history by id

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/catalog/priceList - Retrieve priceList for a given subscription and date

recommendations: Add caching tests: request without If-None-Match -> capture ETag/Cache-Control; repeat with If-None-Match to validate 304 Not Modified and cache directives.

Validate error responses: assert application/json Content-Type and a consistent error schema (code, message, details, requestId) for 4xx/5xx.
Extend date validation: add cases for impossible dates, leap day, timezone boundary (23:59:59Z vs tenant tz) to ensure correct effective price list resolution.

Document pagination as not applicable in Background or a scenario note to align with guidelines and avoid test debt.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/invoicePayments/{paymentId}/tags - Add tags to payment

Invalid Payload: Malformed JSON, unexpected fields, invalid data types/nulls, and invalid UUID formats return 400 (TC08–TC10, TC17).

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/invoiceItems/{invoiceItemId}/customFields - Retrieve invoice item custom fields

gaps: DELETE Method - Soft Deletes: No checks for soft-deletion behavior or audit/history visibility after deletion.

Error Response Contract: Tests don’t assert Content-Type (e.g., application/json) and error schema for 4xx/5xx responses; story states produces application/json.
Audit Trail: No verification that CreatedBy/Reason/Comment are persisted in audit logs/history for the bundle or tag changes.
Authorization Granularity: 401 is covered; no scenario for authenticated but forbidden user (403) or tenant/account boundary enforcement.
Mixed Existing/Non-Existing tagDef Values: Case where tagDef contains valid UUIDs not currently on the bundle (should ignore vs error) is not tested.
Duplicate tagDef Parameters: Behavior when duplicate tag UUIDs are passed is not exercised.
Content Negotiation/Headers on 204: No assertion that 204 responses omit body and use appropriate headers (e.g., no Content-Type), consistent with spec.
Rate Limiting/Throttling: No scenario for 429 Too Many Requests under burst deletes.
Observability: No checks for correlation/request IDs or server-side logging expectations on failures (if required by standards).
recommendations: Add soft delete/audit scenarios: verify tag removal is reflected in audit logs/history and confirm whether deletion is soft or hard per Kill Bill conventions.
Add idempotency tests: repeat the DELETE on the same bundle and with tagDefs already removed; expect 204 and no-op state changes.
Validate error contract: assert application/json Content-Type for error responses and validate error schema fields (code, message, type).
Verify audit headers persistence: CreatedBy, Reason, and Comment should appear in audit entries associated with the deletion event.
Cover authorization 403: use an authenticated user lacking permission to ensure proper 403 Forbidden behavior if applicable.
Test mixed existing/non-existing tags: include tagDef values where some are valid UUIDs not present on the bundle; define expected behavior (ignore vs 400) and assert it.
Handle duplicate tagDef inputs: send repeated identical tagDef parameters and ensure stable 204 behavior and single logical removal.
Assert response headers for 204: ensure no Content-Type and no body are returned; for 4xx/5xx, ensure proper Content-Type and possibly problem details.
Introduce rate limiting scenario: simulate bursts to validate 429 responses or documented behavior.
Extend concurrency coverage: combine selective tagDef deletes concurrently with full-delete to ensure deterministic final state without lost updates.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/invoicePayments - Retrieve account invoice payments

covered_items: Valid Request: Multiple success scenarios validate 200 responses with default behavior and with various query parameters (withPluginInfo, withAttempts, pluginProperty, audit).
Empty Response: Scenario covers accounts with no invoice payments returning an empty JSON array.
Query Parameters: Broad coverage of valid combinations and invalid values (e.g., audit=VERBOSE -> 400), plus extra/ignored parameters and maximum repeats for pluginProperty.
Authorization: 401 for missing/invalid token is covered.
Error Handling: 400 for malformed UUID, 404 for non-existent account, and 503 for service unavailability are included.
Security: Injection/XSS attempts in accountId and pluginProperty are tested.
Performance: Response time under normal and peak load is exercised, as well as very large result sets.
State Variations/Regression: Partially populated DB, regression around pluginProperty filtering, and backward compatibility without query params are covered.
gaps: Pagination: No explicit verification of pagination controls/behavior (e.g., limit/offset parameters, next/prev links, or pagination headers). TC15 is ambiguous and does not assert concrete pagination mechanics.
Caching Behavior: No scenarios validate caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control) or conditional requests (If-None-Match -> 304).
Rate Limiting: No tests for throttling or 429 Too Many Requests under burst traffic.
Authorization (Forbidden): No 403 scenario for authenticated but unauthorized access (e.g., wrong tenant/insufficient permissions).

Response Schema Validation: Assertions are high-level ("required payment fields"); no strict validation of the InvoicePayment schema and nested fields (pluginInfo, attempts, audit) including data types and required/optional presence.
Produces/Header Assertions: Lack of explicit checks for Content-Type application/json and charset, and no negative Accept header behavior.
Error Body Contract: Error responses do not validate a standard error schema (e.g., code, message, type).
Audit Enum Completeness: No explicit test for audit=NONE (default) behavior and field omission/structure compared to MINIMAL and FULL.
Deterministic Behavior in Dependencies: TC18 allows either 503 or partial data; the oracle is non-deterministic and may cause flaky tests.
Input Encoding/Internationalization: Limited coverage for URL encoding and Unicode values in pluginProperty; only basic encoding and XSS are exercised.
recommendations: Add explicit pagination tests: verify presence/behavior of pagination parameters or headers, assert page sizes, next/prev navigation, and stable ordering on large datasets.
Add caching tests: assert ETag/Last-Modified/Cache-Control on 200 responses and validate 304 on conditional GET (If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since).
Introduce rate-limiting scenarios: simulate burst requests and assert 429 with Retry-After headers when applicable.
Add 403 Forbidden scenario for authenticated users lacking required permissions or tenant isolation to complement the 401 test.
Tighten schema validation: assert full InvoicePayment contract (required fields, types, nested pluginInfo/attempts/audit structures) and verify omissions for defaults.
Assert headers: check Content-Type (application/json; charset=utf-8) and optionally Content-Length; add a negative Accept header case (e.g., Accept: application/xml -> 406) if supported.
Standardize error responses: validate error schema fields (code, message, details) for 400/401/403/404/503, not just presence of an error message.
Cover audit=NONE explicitly and compare field presence across NONE, MINIMAL, and FULL to ensure correct redaction/verbosity.
Make TC18 deterministic: define a single expected behavior (e.g., return 503 with a clear error body) or clearly documented partial data contract with a specific warning field.
Expand encoding/i18n tests: include URL-encoded special characters and Unicode in pluginProperty values and assert correct filtering and safe handling.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/pagination - List accounts

covered_items: Valid Request: Multiple success paths validate default behavior and explicit parameters (offset/limit, audit=FULL/MINIMAL, accountWithBalance, accountWithBalanceAndCBA).

Pagination: Offset/limit basics, boundaries, large datasets, and concurrency correctness are covered (e.g., TC02, TC19, TC20, TC21, TC30, TC46–TC49).
Query Parameters: Broad matrix of valid/invalid/malformed inputs including booleans, integers, enums; handling of extra/unsupported parameters; combined parameters.
Authorization: Unauthorized access covered with 401 for missing/invalid credentials.
Error Handling: Invalid parameters (400), method not allowed (405), dependency failures (503), network timeouts and recovery.
Security: SQL injection and XSS attempts rejected; no compromise or script reflection.
Resilience/Recovery: Retries after transient network and dependency failures succeed.
Performance/Load: Response-time expectations for large volumes and degraded system load.
Backward Compatibility/Regression: Contract and boundary regression scenarios.
Accessibility: Valid JSON and descriptive error messages.
gaps: Rate Limiting: No scenarios for throttling or 429 responses when many requests are sent rapidly.
Caching Behavior: No validation of ETag/Last-Modified, Cache-Control/Expires headers, or conditional GET (If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since) and 304 handling.
Response Headers: Content-Type application/json and charset are not explicitly asserted; Accept/Content-Negotiation not exercised.
Authorization Depth: No 403 Forbidden test for authenticated user lacking permission/role.
Schema Validation: Tests refer to Account objects but do not validate against the #/definitions/Account schema (required fields, types, formats).

Deterministic Ordering: No assertion that pagination order is stable/deterministic across pages (prevents duplicate/missing items when paginating).

Produces/Acceptability: No test for Produces application/json in the OpenAPI sense, or rejection of unacceptable Accept headers (406).
recommendations: Add rate limiting tests: burst N requests within a window; expect 429 with Retry-After and verify subsequent backoff succeeds.
Add caching tests: initial GET returns ETag/Cache-Control; repeat with If-None-Match to expect 304; verify cache headers for both success and empty responses.
Assert response headers: Content-Type application/json; optionally Content-Length; verify no sensitive headers are leaked.
Add a 403 Forbidden scenario for an authenticated user without required permissions (if applicable to deployment).
Introduce JSON schema validation against #/definitions/Account, including presence/absence of balance/CBA/audit fields under different flags.
Add an explicit audit=NONE scenario to confirm behavior equals default.
Verify deterministic ordering for pagination (e.g., order by accountId asc) and that consecutive pages are non-overlapping and complete when iterating.
Clarify and test server policy for extreme offset/limit: document whether values are capped or rejected; write precise expectations (e.g., 400 with error code KB_PAGINATION_LIMIT_EXCEEDED).
Add content negotiation scenarios: Accept application/json succeeds; unacceptable Accept yields 406.
Reduce duplication by consolidating overlapping scenarios (e.g., TC01/TC43/TC50; TC26/TC42) and keep a focused parameter combination matrix.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/paymentMethods/refresh - Refresh account payment methods

PUT - Non-Existing Resource: 404 when account does not exist, including empty DB state (TC09, TC27).

Error mapping for dependencies: External gateway/plugin service outages and timeouts return 502/503/504 (TC13, TC20, TC25).

Security hardening: SQL injection and XSS attempts rejected (TC16, TC17).

Error responses clarity/accessibility covered at a high level (TC30).
gaps: PUT - Partial Update semantics: No negative test that rejects an unexpected request body (body is N/A per story) with a 400/415.
Idempotency/retry safety: No scenario verifying repeated identical refresh requests do not create duplicate side effects and remain 204.
Response headers/body for 204: No assertion that there is no response body and that Content-Type is appropriate/absent for 204 despite "produces: application/json".
Standardized error schema: No checks that 4xx/5xx error bodies conform to the API error contract (fields, codes).
500 Internal Server Error: No simulation of server-side failures (e.g., DB outage) returning 500 with proper payload.
Authorization depth: No 403 Forbidden scenario for authenticated but unauthorized principal/role.
Rate limiting/throttling: No tests for too many requests leading to 429 or appropriate headers, if applicable.
Method semantics: No negative tests for wrong HTTP methods (e.g., POST/GET on this path returning 405).
Auditability: No verification that X-Killbill-CreatedBy/Reason/Comment are persisted to audit logs/history for the operation.
Multi-tenant/headers (if applicable to Kill Bill): No scenarios for required tenant headers or cross-tenant isolation.
recommendations: Add a negative test that sends a non-empty request body and expects 400 or 415 to confirm no partial update/payload is accepted.
Add idempotency tests: invoke the same refresh repeatedly and verify 204 each time and no duplicate payment method artifacts.
Assert 204 response has no body and validate response headers (e.g., Content-Type handling for empty responses).
Validate standardized error schema: verify error code, message, and fields for 400/404/401/5xx responses.
Introduce a 500 Internal Server Error simulation (e.g., database failure) and assert proper handling and response.
Add a 403 Forbidden scenario for users lacking permission while authenticated.
If rate limits apply, add scenarios to trigger and assert 429 with Retry-After headers.
Add method-negatives (GET/POST/DELETE on the same path) asserting 405 Method Not Allowed.
Add audit verification: check that CreatedBy/Reason/Comment are recorded in audit logs or refresh history.
If the API is multi-tenant, include scenarios with/without tenant headers and cross-tenant isolation checks.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/invoicePayments/{paymentId}/customFields - Add custom fields to payment

covered_items: POST - Valid Payload: Happy-path creation with 201 and response array (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC05).
POST - Invalid Payload: Malformed JSON (400) and missing required properties (400) are covered (TC08, TC16).
POST - Large Payload: Handled via 201 or 413, with expectations for both outcomes (TC15).

POST - Validation: paymentId UUID format validation (400), required header X-Killbill-CreatedBy, optional headers behavior, unsupported query params and extra body fields (TC02, TC06, TC09, TC10, TC17).
Error Scenarios per story: 400 for invalid paymentId/malformed body; 404 when payment not found (TC08, TC10, TC11).
Authorization: 401 for missing/invalid auth token (TC12).
Resilience/Server-side failure: Dependent service down returns 503 (TC13).
Security/robustness inputs: Injection/XSS handling and unicode handling (TC14, TC21).
Persistence/integration: Verify created fields retrievable via GET and reflected downstream (TC24, TC25).
Performance and concurrency: Normal/peak load SLAs and concurrent POSTs without data loss (TC19, TC22, TC23).
gaps: POST - Duplicate Submission: No scenario covers resubmitting the same payload (e.g., retries) and expected idempotency or deduplication behavior (409/200/201).
POST - Server Error Handling (500): Only 503 is covered; no test for unexpected internal errors returning 500 and error schema.
Response headers/content negotiation: No explicit check that response Content-Type is application/json as per produces, or handling of Accept header (406).
Deterministic outcomes: Tests allow multiple possible results (201 or 400) for empty arrays and extra fields; should assert the single expected behavior per API spec.
Auditing/traceability: No verification that X-Killbill-Reason and X-Killbill-Comment are persisted/audited in metadata/history.

Business validation details: No explicit checks for objectType correctness (e.g., INVOICE_PAYMENT), allowed/maximum lengths for fieldName/fieldValue, or character set constraints beyond unicode/injection.
Authorization granularity: 403 Forbidden (authorized but not permitted) is not covered when tokens are valid but lack permissions.

Idempotency/duplicate field names across repeated calls: Regression test touches duplicate field names in one request, but not behavior when the same field is posted again in subsequent requests (e.g., update vs. reject vs. create duplicate).
Rate limiting/throttling: Not covered under high-frequency POSTs beyond general performance; expected 429 behavior if applicable.
Error response schema: No assertions that error responses include standardized fields (e.g., code, message, requestId) for 400/404/401/503.
recommendations: Add a duplicate submission scenario: resend the identical payload and assert expected behavior (idempotency key if supported, 200/201/409, and resultant state).
Add 500 Internal Server Error simulation (e.g., forced exception) and verify status code and error payload contract.
Assert response headers: check Content-Type: application/json and optionally Location (if applicable), and include an Accept header test (406 for unsupported).
Make outcomes deterministic: split TC06/TC07 into separate cases that assert the single behavior defined by the API spec and update the spec if ambiguous.
Verify auditing: after sending X-Killbill-Reason and X-Killbill-Comment, retrieve audit logs/metadata to confirm they were recorded.
Expand validation tests: enforce objectType in response, fieldName/fieldValue length limits, allowed characters, and rejection/sanitization policies with precise expectations and status codes.
Add a 403 Forbidden scenario for authenticated users lacking permissions.
Test posting the same custom field(s) in subsequent calls to define behavior (overwrite, reject with 409, or create duplicate) and assert final state.
If applicable, add rate limiting tests to validate 429 responses under burst traffic.
Standardize error schema checks across 400/401/404/413/503 to ensure consistent fields (code, message, type, requestId).

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/catalog/simplePlan - Add a simple plan entry in the current version of the catalog

covered_items: POST - Valid Payload: Multiple successful creation scenarios (TC01, TC02, TC12, TC13, TC19, TC20, TC21, TC23) returning 201 and verifying retrievability in at least one case.

POST - Invalid Payload: Missing required header (TC03), missing required body fields (TC04), invalid enum/value like currency (TC05), empty body (TC08), malformed JSON (TC09), XSS/SQLi-style bad input (TC18).
POST - Duplicate Submission/Conflict: Duplicate planId handled with error (TC06).
POST - Large Payloads: Very large payload behavior covered (TC15).
POST - Validation: Max/min field boundaries (TC12, TC13), schema tolerance to extra fields (TC07), invalid value handling (TC05, TC18).
Authorization/Authentication: Unauthenticated request returns 401 (TC10).
Error Handling (non-2xx): Service/catalalog unavailable returns 503 (TC11); method not allowed returns 405 (TC14).
Resilience and reliability: Retry after transient network error (TC16); concurrent requests behavior (TC22).
Non-functional: Response time threshold measured (TC17).
Integration behavior: With dependencies healthy/degraded (TC23, TC24).
gaps: POST - Server Error Handling: No scenario for unexpected 500 Internal Server Error (e.g., DB failure) and how it’s surfaced.
POST - Idempotency/Duplicate Submission semantics: No test for safe retry of the exact same request (same planId/body) to ensure deterministic result without creating duplicates or misleading errors.
POST - Header validation: No explicit checks for Content-Type application/json (415 on wrong/missing content type) or Accept header negotiation (406).
POST - Authorization/Permissions: 403 forbidden (authenticated but not authorized) is not covered.
POST - Detailed field validation: No tests for invalid billingPeriod/productCategory enums, negative/over-precision amount, unsupported currency for tenant, or cross-field rules.
POST - Response contract: No validation of response headers (e.g., Location or content-type for the returned string/JSON), and no schema for the confirmation payload.
Auditability: No verification that X-Killbill-CreatedBy/Reason/Comment are persisted to audit logs and attached to the catalog change.
Rate Limiting/Throttling: No scenario for 429 or graceful handling under bursts beyond TC22 happy-path concurrency.
Data integrity and side effects: No test ensuring the live catalog versioning and rollback behavior on partial failures or dependency errors.
Security hardening: No CSRF or header injection checks; only basic XSS/SQLi in body fields are covered.
recommendations: Add a scenario simulating an internal server/database failure to validate 500 response mapping and error body contract.

Introduce idempotent-retry tests: send the same POST twice under uncertain prior outcome and verify one plan exists, with appropriate status code (e.g., second returns 400/409 with clear conflict reason).
Add content negotiation tests: missing/incorrect Content-Type returns 415; unsupported Accept returns 406; verify response Content-Type and, if applicable, Location header.
Include a 403 authorization scenario (authenticated user lacking rights) distinct from 401.
Expand field-level validation: invalid billingPeriod/productCategory enums, negative/zero amount rules, precision/scale limits, unsupported currency, and cross-field constraints.
Validate response contract explicitly: define and assert the format of the confirmation string/URI and required headers.
Add audit verification: confirm CreatedBy/Reason/Comment are recorded and retrievable via audit endpoints or logs.
Add rate-limiting/throttling scenarios to verify 429 behavior and proper Retry-After headers when limits are exceeded.
Test transactional integrity: simulate dependent service partial failures to confirm rollback or compensating actions and catalog version consistency.
Extend security tests to include CSRF token requirements (if applicable) and header injection attempts, and verify they are rejected.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId} - Retrieve an account by id

Authorization: 401 covered for missing and invalid tokens.

Performance/Robustness: Large payload handling and concurrent requests, backward compatibility regression checks.

gaps: Rate Limiting: No tests for throttling behavior or 429 Too Many Requests when exceeding limits.

Content Negotiation: No tests for Accept header handling (e.g., application/json vs unsupported types leading to 406 Not Acceptable).

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/admin/payments/{paymentId}/transactions/{paymentTransactionId} - Update existing paymentTransaction and associated payment state

covered_items: PUT - Valid Request: Happy-path updates return 204 and persist changes (TC01, TC02, TC13, TC14, TC15, TC23, TC24, TC25, TC26).
PUT - Non-Existing Resource: Proper 404s for missing payment/transaction and mismatched IDs (TC06, TC07, TC12, TC27).

Headers: Required X-Killbill-CreatedBy enforced (TC03); optional X-Killbill-Reason/Comment handled and combinations covered (TC02, TC24); whitespace/case variations tolerated (TC26).
Authorization: 401 for missing/invalid credentials (TC11).
Resilience/Failures: Backend slow/dependency timeout results in 503/504 (TC16); degraded dependency behavior covered (TC22).

Audit/Reason Capture: No verification that X-Killbill-Reason and X-Killbill-Comment are persisted to audit logs/history as expected.

recommendations: Add explicit partial-update tests: one with only a subset of mutable fields expecting success if allowed; one attempting to update read-only/derived fields expecting 400; and one clarifying behavior when fields are omitted (merge vs replace).
Add idempotency scenario: send the same PUT twice; verify second call returns 204 and state remains unchanged with no duplicate side-effects.

Validate Content-Type/Accept: test missing Content-Type, wrong Content-Type, and explicit Accept headers; expect 415 Unsupported Media Type or 400 per API contract, and verify no response body on 204.
Introduce server failure simulation to assert 500 Internal Server Error handling and stable error contract.

Expand state-machine tests: enumerate key valid transitions (e.g., PENDING->SUCCESS, PENDING->FAILED, retry flows) and specific invalid transitions (e.g., SUCCESS->PENDING), verifying both transaction and payment aggregate states.
Verify audit trail: assert X-Killbill-CreatedBy/Reason/Comment are persisted and retrievable via audit endpoints/logs with correct timestamps.
Add test to confirm aggregate payment fields (lastSuccessPaymentState, currentPaymentStateName) are updated consistently with transaction status changes.
If rate limiting applies, add scenarios to trigger and verify 429 Too Many Requests with Retry-After header.
Standardize error schema checks: validate error response body structure and required fields across 400/401/404/5xx, including correlation/request ID headers.

Authorization (Forbidden): No 403 scenario for authenticated user lacking admin privileges.
Content-Type consistency: Only TC01 asserts application/octet-stream; other successful scenarios should also assert it.
Date edge cases: No test for minDate > maxDate, timezone handling, or single-sided ranges (only minDate or only maxDate).
Parameter validation breadth: No tests for empty string values, whitespace-only params, or duplicate query params (e.g., multiple accountId values).
Response schema/structure: No explicit validation of the octet-stream payload format (e.g., expected serialization) or consistent error schema across all error cases.
Internationalization/encoding: No tests for URL encoding or non-ASCII values in queueName/serviceName beyond security attempts.
recommendations: Add pagination scenarios: verify default page size, navigating pages, boundaries, and stable ordering for large datasets; assert related headers or links if applicable.
Introduce rate limiting tests: burst of requests leading to 429, validate Retry-After headers and proper recovery after backoff.
Add caching tests: assert ETag/Cache-Control on 200 responses; exercise If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since to get 304 and validate cache validators change when data changes.
Add a 403 Forbidden scenario for authenticated but non-admin users.
Assert content type application/octet-stream in all successful retrieval scenarios, not just TC01.
Extend date validation: scenarios for minDate only, maxDate only, minDate > maxDate (expect 400), and timezone/ISO-8601 compliance.
Broaden parameter validation: tests for empty/blank values, duplicate parameters (define precedence), and mixed valid+invalid params to ensure appropriate error handling.
Define and verify the binary payload format: document expected serialization and validate structure/fields after decoding; ensure errors follow a consistent JSON schema across 400/404/5xx.
Add URL-encoding tests for special and non-ASCII characters in queueName/serviceName to ensure correct handling without corruption.
